Lidia is part of the group. She indicates that this is the third year belonging to Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a supporter of the institution who visited her at home.

Currently she has two hand-spun vicuna wool businesses. She learned from her mother years ago and today she still works at it. The loan that she is now taking is to increase her capital (to buy vicuna wool) that she will buy from the popular markets in the city of El Alto, and later she will sell her creations from orders. This kind of work permits her to generate income to support as much as possible her household as she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the credit and health training.

loans.use: to buy vicuna wool to make her creations to sell later

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 39 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has two children. 

Danilo is engaged in a hog-raising business. He earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan, which he will use to purchase feed and vaccines for his hogs. 
 
Danilo has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vaccines

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva, 63 years old, has 6 children. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Philippines. For the past 5 years, Genoveva has owned and operated a business, selling a variety of dresses and ready-to-wear products. She earns PHP 8,000 monthly from her business. Genoveva has requested a loan of PHP 11,500 to buy new sets of ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Genoveva joined GDMPC in 2007. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to buy new sets of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 36 years old, is married and has one child. She lives in Tipan, Oroquieta City. For the past 9 years, Josephine has operated a general store. She has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. for her store. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Primetiva

texts.en: Primetiva, 62 years old, is married and has seven children. She lives in Lawa-an, Aloran Misamis Occidental. Primetiva has a hog fattening business. She has requested a loan to renovate her house. Primetiva has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-year-old married man with two children. He used to work as a nurse. In February 2011, he opened his own business, a small grocery store in the Palestinian camp where he lives with his family. He hoped to improve his family's living by increasing their income.
Mahmoud insisted on starting his own business because several job opportunities are unavailable for Palestinian refugees since certain boundaries limit their ability to develop better careers.
He is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital with special product offerings, especially cereals and hot drinks for the winter.
This will be his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and Mahmoud has a good repayment record.
He hopes to use this loan to continue to improve his business as much as he can. His previous loan served his business well because it allowed him to use special discounts to introduce new products to clients.

loans.use: To increase his business capital with special product offerings, especially cereals and hot drinks for the winter

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger, 43 years old, is from Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has two children. For the past 8 years, Roger has operated a motorcycle transport service business, earning 6,000 PHP per month.

Roger joined GDMPC in 2007. He is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Roger plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita, 70 years old, is widowed and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 9 years, Amelita has operated a general store in the Philippines. She has previously received funds through Kiva. Amelita has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of grocery items to sell. Amelita hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, 44 years old, is married and has four children. She lives in Mangguihan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Editha has a general store and she earns PHP 9,000 monthly from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. for her store. Editha has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Fany Yaneth

texts.es: Fany  de 27 años de edad, es una joven madre de un pequeño de 6 años de edad, ella es muy responsable y vive junto a su madre y una hermana. Fany posee una venta de frutas a las afueras de un mercado, ella ha poseído este negocio desde hace 5 años atrás lo que es muy positivo ya que las personas la conocen muy bien. De esta manera Fany ha logrado brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijo, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en la espera de realizar la mayor cantidad de ventas posibles. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas,  ya que ella comercializa por mayor y así mismo por unidad, lo que le permite contar con muchas ventas. Fany desea mejorar sus ganancias, ya que ella es la única que posee trabajo en su hogar, es por ello que debe optimizar su servicio y de esta forma obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Fany is 27 years old and is the young mother of a six year old boy.  She is very responsible and lives with her mother and sister.  Fany has a small fruit selling business outside the market.  She has had this business for five years.  It’s gone well and is very well known.  Fany has managed to provide everything for her son in this manner, working from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm in the hopes that she will make the greatest number of sales possible.

She is asking for a loan so that she can buy fruit in quantity and variety.  She sells in quantity and in small amounts and this will allow her to count on a large number of sales.  Fany wants to improve her earnings since she is the only one who works in her household, so she needs to optimize her business and gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene is a 31-year-old resident of St. Cruz, Tangub City. She provides for her 2 children's needs from the small amount of PHP 5,000 she gains monthly from her poultry business, which she has operated for 5 years as an aid to her husband's income. Mylene became a member of GDMPC in 2010. She has applied for a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase feed and other supplies. Mylene wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lave

texts.en: Lave is a 24-year-old single lady. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, and tomatoes to earn a living. Lave has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knapsack spray, a file, a spade, an axe, a wheelbarrow, etc. Lave will use her profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy an axe, a spade, chemicals, knives, a file, a wheelbarrow, knapsnack spray, etc. for her farming business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old, married and has 6 children, two of whom are in school. 

Analyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analyn has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lester José

texts.es:
El señor Lester José vive en un populoso barrio de la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, actualmente trabaja para el estado desempeñándose como soldador  desde hace tres años, es una persona responsable.
  
don Lester José  solicita a ceprodel un tercer crédito para seguir construyendo poco a poco su vivienda, en esta ocasión lo necesita para cambiar el techo ya que esta en mal estado.

Con este tercer financiamiento lo invertirá  en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cinc, madera, clavo y poder reparar su techo.
texts.en:
Lester José lives in a populated neighborhood in Managua, Nicaragua.  For three years he has been working for the state as a welder.  He is a very responsible person.

Lester José is asking CEPRODEL for his third loan so that he can continue building his house little by little.  On this occasion he needs to replace the roof because it’s in bad shape.

He will use the money from this loan to buy building materials such as zinc metal sheeting, lumber, and nails so that he can repair his roof.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Seak is 37 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than ten years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals. She makes an approximate income of $2 daily. Her husband (who is with her in the picture) sells coconuts. He earns about $6 per day. In order to improve her husband's business, Seak is requesting a loan of $400 to pay to hire a store to sell coconuts. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to hire a store to sell coconuts sold by her husband.

loans.name: Félix  Elías

texts.es:
El Señor Félix Elías es trabajador  de una institución del estado en Managua, donde se desempeña como inspector de campo desde hace seis años, es  casado con tres personas a su cargo, responsable, con buenos valores morales.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento, bloque, este crédito lo invertirá en reforzar las paredes de su casa y repellarla para el bienestar y estabilidad de su familia.  

Los sueños de Don Félix Elías es ver su casita bien acondicionada con el apoyo que Ceprodel y kiva le pueda brindarle.
texts.en:
Félix Elías is a hardworking man who has been working for six years as a field inspector for the state in Managua.  He is married, has three people to support, and is of good moral character.

He is asking CEPRODEL for this loan in order to buy building materials such as sand, cement, and cinder blocks to reinforce the walls of his house and repair it for his family’s wellbeing. 

Félix Elías’ dreams are to see his house very well set up and he will be able to do this with CEPRODEL’s and Kiva’s support.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes, 48, is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, an employee, and a mother. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually earn an income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mercedes hopes to expand her business and dreams to have her house renovated through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business inventory.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

NWTF is re-listing Cora's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy, 30 years old, is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 5 years, Cristy has operated a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell. In the future, Cristy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita previously accessed a 27,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

Teresita would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better, as more items to sell will result in better profit. Teresita's profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is a 43-year-old resident of Barangay 5, Tangub City. She helps meet her family's needs from the small monthly amount of PHP 5,000 she earns from her banana production business, which she has operated for 7 years. Flordeliza became a member of GDMPC in 2009. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Flordeliza wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and married with four children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Elena has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Logo

texts.en: Logo is 49 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, and beans that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Logo needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and spades. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Logo will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, spades, etc.

loans.name: Saidjalol

texts.ru: Саидджалолу 26 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Его ребенку 2 года. Он единственный кормилец в семье, так как его жена домохозяйка и нигде не работает. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 5 лет назад он начал свой бизнес услугой таксиста. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он обслуживает своих клиентов на высшем уровне. Несмотря на все его достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет его быть внимательным, и обновлять машину. Он имеет немного сбережения, но это не хватит для покупки новой машины. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони  для покупки машины. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает оплатить займ во время. Давайте, ему поможем держать свой стимул среди бизнесменов.
texts.en:
Saidjalol is 26 years old, married, and has a two-year-old child.  His wife, a homemaker, does not work outside of the house, so he is the sole breadwinner in his family.  In order to provide his family with all the necessities of life, Saidjalol started his own business five years ago, providing taxi services. Thanks to his professional efficiency, he is successful in his field and he provides a very high quality of service to his clients.

In spite of all his qualities, Saidjalol faces fierce competition from the business world, which forces him to be foresighted and to renew his car.  Saidjalol has a few savings, but they are not sufficient to buy a new car.  This is why he is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to purchase a new car.  

Saidjalol relies on your kindness and promises to repay his loan on time.  Let's help him to keep his competitive edge in his business!

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique vive en un municipio de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona responsable trabajador, tiene una familia con dos  hijos y junto con su esposa saldrán adelante para un futuro mejor.

Don Luis Enrique labora como inspector de campo, en una empresa del estado desde hace tres años.

Solicita a CEPRODEL un crédito para gasto de uso personal.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por la oportunidad  y la confianza que le den  con este tercer financiamiento a otorgándole, porque solo así a podido resolver.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique lives in Managua, Nicaragua and is a hardworking, responsible man.  He has a family that includes his wife and two children.  Together they will come out ahead with a better future.

Luis Enrique has been working as a field inspector for a state-owned company for three years.

He is requesting a loan through CEPRODEL for personal use.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for the opportunity and trust given him through this loan.  This is the only way he has been able to get one.

loans.use: to use for personal expenses.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is from Silanga, Tangub City. She is 21 years old, married, and has 2 children. To make a living, she manages a fishpond where she raises fish, crabs and shrimp for sale. She's been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. Recently, Cherry joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 15,500 PHP, which will be used to buy twine and young fish to raise to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy twine and young fish to raise

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 61 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by selling used clothing. She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is married and works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs and noodles. She has been in this business for 20 years and her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling jewelry in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more accessories and jewelry to sell to customers.

NWTF is relisting Eleonor's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Jenny

texts.en: Ma. Jenny is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Ma. Jenny has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casada,  vive con sus hijos y esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de  madera, pintura y otros materiales que requiere y además pagar mano de obra para la reparación de su casa, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores materiales y aprovechar las ofertas que se presentan en estos días y que sean de buena calidad para que su casa quede en buen estado y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Con las mejoras a su vivienda espera tener un lugar más adecuado donde vivir un ambiente adecuado para el desarrollo de sus hijos y tener más liquidez para poder pagar sus estudiar y así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mariana is 36 years old. She is married and lives with her children and her husband, who are her greatest priority. With her loan she intends to purchase wood, paint, and other materials that she needs and also pay for labor to repair her house, and in this way she will be sure of having the work done well. What she wants is to be able to buy the best materials and take advantage of the bargains that appear at this time and which are of good quality, so that her house will remain in good condition and thus [the loan] will improve their quality of life. With the improvements in her house, she hopes to have a more suitable place to live and an appropriate environment for the development of her children and to have more liquidity to be able to pay for their schooling, and thus they can have a better quality of life. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in the past from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en: Ma. Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like caps, pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing. NWTF is relisting Ma. Elena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like caps, pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a 38-year-old resident of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She provides for her four children's needs from the little amount of 8,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business that she has been managing for five years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. However, in 2009 she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan at GDMPC in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. She wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: To buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Ma. Cecile

texts.en: Ma. Cecile is 34 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Ma. Cecile runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries. In the future, Ma. Cecile would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 47 years old and married with two children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Marilou aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Monina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from E-loading. Monina is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities with her past 21 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Robert Michael

texts.en: Robert Michael, 29, is a single man from Mabini Extension, Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. To make a living, Robert Michael owns and operates a boarding house. Robert Michael been in this business for 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. He joined GDMPC in 2011. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair his boarding house so that he can offer better services. He also plans to use his loan to expand to his business.

loans.use: to repair his boarding house.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nelinda requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Nelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky is 31 years old, married and the mother of one child. She works very hard to provide for her family by buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for one year and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.
She has been selling onions and tomatoes for five years, working six days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.
She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bags of onions and tomatoes for selling. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her businesses, start growing these vegetables and build her own house. She joined MCDT because she wanted more money for her business. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 31, is a married entrepreneur from Sangay Daku, Ozamis City. She has 4 children and makes a living from her transport service business. She has been running it for almost 5 years now and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. She’s hopeful that she can expand her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 51 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Nenita has been in her current line of work for six years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is 25 years old, married and the mother of one child. She works very hard to provide for her family by buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in business for one year and would like to save enough money to expand her business and secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom is a tailor who assists in her husband’s farming business when she is free. Her husband is a rice and lotus farmer. The have been married since 1973 and have six sons: three are married and live outside the family home, one is a construction worker, one is a fisherman and the last is a farmer. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Rom once asked for Kiva loan (www.kiva.org/lend/254737). She is now asking for another in the amount of $1,000 to supply her husband’s farming business. With this loan, Rom’s husband will buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide and a pesticide applicator.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide and a pesticide applicator.

loans.name: Tedelyn

texts.en:
Tedelyn is 47 years old and single.

Tedelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Tedelyn aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 54 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City where she has earned a living for the last six years by running a general store. She earns 8,000 PHP a month and has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy more items such as candies, milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps and other items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue she earns from this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 64 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell at her store.

Anecita has been in this business for 15 years. She sells sugar, noodles, canned goods and a variety of other groceries. 

In the future, Anecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is 57 years old and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store such as sugar, canned goods, milk, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for 20 years now and earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store such as sugar, canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a Palestinian single young man, a worker with a low income. Ahmad wants to complete building his own house, preparing himself to get married soon. 

Ameen took a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing necessary construction supplies. This loan will allow Ameen to cover some of the construction expenses and offer him suitable home conditions to live in with his coming wife. Ameen appears in the photo

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete building his house

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 50, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Emilio, a storekeeper, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marivic operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like rice, pork, chicken, fish, pasta and other ingredients. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marivic hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of giving her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients rice, pork, chicken, fish, pasta and other ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store and cultured seaweeds. Ma. Luisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing/fish vending business.

Ma. Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
This is Mirasol.  She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy an additional machine for alkaline processing. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education, and for personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional filters for alkaline. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mirasol dreams of expanding and having new branches in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional filters for alkaline needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosario hopes to expand her business through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products .

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El Comité se llama Oñondivepa, que significa, todas juntas. Este grupo lleva ese nombre, ya que las 10 mujeres se unieron y quieren poder trabajar para salir adelante. Gracias a su esfuerzo ya están en su cuarto ciclo  quieren poder seguir trabajando.
Valeria es una de estas mujeres, que con el correr de los ciclos ha aprendido como ir mejorando su trabajo, el cual es una peluquería, y así está saliendo adelante. Su grupo le ha sido de mucha ayuda ya que ha aprendido mucho. Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar shampoo, enjuagues, tintes y demás insumos para utilizar en su negocio y seguir dando un buen servicio y buena calidad.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Oñondivepa, which means "everyone together." This group has this name because the 10 women joined together and wanted to be able to work to advance. Thanks to their effort, they are now in their fourth loan cycle. They want to be able to continue working.

Valeria is one of these women, who in the course of the loan cycles has learned how to continue improving her work, which is a beauty salon, and thus she is getting ahead. Her group has been a lot of help to her, since she has learned a lot. She is applying for this loan to be able to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, and other supplies to use in her business and to continue giving good service and good quality work.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, and other items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman and a mother of three children from Trinidad, Bohol in the Philippines. She has run a sari-sari or variety store for almost two years. This is the source of her income. Her husband is carpenter.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell, like canned goods, snack food, candies, soda, and toiletries. In the future, Jocelyn dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell, like canned goods, snack food, candies, soda, and toiletries.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres progresistas lleva por nombre este grupo, ya que son 14 mujeres que desean progresar y por ese objetivo es que están luchando, quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que puedan en sus posibilidades.
La Sra. María Cristina está casada y tiene 6 hijos es muy loable lo que hace para mantener a todos ellos se dedica al faenamiento de animales y vende en su comunidad, del préstamo que solicita es para poner un puesto de venta (mini carnicería) frente a su casa. Esta muy agradecida con la oportunidad que se le está dando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is named "Mujeres Progresistas" (Progressive Women), because they are 14 women who want to make progress, and this is the goal that they are striving toward.  They want to give their families everything they possibly can.

Maria Cristina is married and has 6 children, and what she does to support all of them is very impressive.  She has a business butchering and selling animals in her community.  She will use this loan to set up a sales stall (mini meat market) in front of her house.  She is very grateful for being provided with this opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: to set up a sales stall

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ana trabaja en su propio salón de belleza en donde se dedica a realizar tintes, planchados y secados de cabello, faciales, cortes de cabellos y otros servicios más. Así mismo realiza pupusas por las noches, con l que puede mejorar sus ganancias. Ana solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar mayor cantidad de productos de belleza como tintes, tijeras nuevas, espejos, sillas, cosméticos, cremas para el cabello y otros. Ana es una persona que cuenta con la ilusión de mejorar  lo más posible su negocio, mejorar sus servicios y de esta manera crecer continuamente para vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 40, is a responsible and hardworking person who lives with her husband and 2 children.  Ana has a beauty salon where she straightens and blow-dries hair, and does hair coloring, facials, haircuts, and other services.  She also makes pupusas (thick, stuffed corn tortillas) at night to increase her income.  

Ana is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a large quantity of beauty products such as: hair dyes, new scissors, mirrors, chairs, cosmetics, hair creams, and other items.  Ana is a person who dreams of improving her business as much as she can, improving her services and in this way continuing to grow the business so that she can live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, de 50 años, es un hombre muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su casa propia solo ya que hace algunos meses se separo de quien fue su esposa por mu7chos años y con quien tuvo tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores e independiente y solo la menor de 17 años depende de el para poder continuar con sus estudios y por quien trabaja día a día para darle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Enrrique es uno de sus múltiples oficios que realizo en toda su vida, ahora se decida al trabajo de la albañilería y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos, ya que cuando hay un obras o hay que levantar una pared en alguna casa de la ciudad de Pucallpa, él es el albañil con más experiencia en su zona y es por eso que todos recurren a el, trabaja con la cantidad de personas que requiere para poder terminar una obra depende de la magnitud se encarga de contratar a la gente, le esta yendo bien en lo que hace ya que a parte de tener este trabajo, también se dedica a manejar su mototaxi que le significa una entrada adicional a su economía. Disfruta mucho de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con esta digna profesión pudo brindar educación y buena calidad de vida a su familia, lleva 12 años realizando esta profesión y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que ha hecho que sus manos envejezcan rápidamente, desea renovar sus herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace, además remodelar algunas piezas que necesita cambiar de su vehiculo. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP, esta muy emocionado de saber que le darán un respaldo económico para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo responsable, esta muy contento se continuar con este grupo ya que son muy cumplidos y amables.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo como maderas y listones, además de algunas herramientas y piezas para cambiar a los que están defectuosas de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Enrique is 50 years old and is a very sincere and hardworking man.  He lives in a home of his own and separated from his wife of many years just a few months ago.  They had three children together, two of whom are adults and on their own.  Only the youngest one, age 17, depends on him so that he can continue his studies.  He is the reason he works; so that he can provide him with a better quality of life.

Enrique works in multiple trades that he has done all his life.  At the moment he is working as a mason and he is well sought after by his neighbors whenever they have a job or a wall that needs to be built anywhere in Pucallpa.  He is the most experienced mason, so he is the most sought after.  He works with the number of people he needs to complete the task and hires people as needed.  He is doing well because aside from doing this work he also drives a moto-taxi, which provides him with an additional income.

He likes to work in construction.  He knows that this is a dignified profession and he was able to provide a good education and quality of life for his family.  He has been doing this for 12 years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying the heavy bricks and having to handle the cement with his hands, which speeds up their aging.  He wants to update his tools so that he can improve the work he does.  He also wants to update some parts on his vehicle.

This will be his 14th loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that they will give him financial backing to continue with his plans.  He doesn’t want to not be able to repay due to lack of funds, so he is committed to being on time and responsible.  He is very happy to be able to continue with this group because they follow through and are friendly.

He will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy supplies, such as lumber and slats to be able to continue with his work.  He will also buy some tools and parts to change out the defective ones on his moto-taxi.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts ans supplies.

loans.name: Mistehan

texts.ru: Мистехан 53 года, мать 4 детей. Мистехан в качестве основного дохода на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки одной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Мистехан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойная корова,10 овец, 1 лошадь, ежемесячный доход от продажи молока составляет около 5,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мистехан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы  и 1 го жеребенка для увеличения доходов от сдачи молока. Доходы от кредита Мистехан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшем будущем планирует построить дом и женить сына
texts.en: Mistehan is 53 years old and is the mother of 4 children.  Mistehan has been raising livestock for 5 years as the main source of income, having started this business with the purchase of one cow.  Thanks to Mistehan's hard work her household now has 2 dairy cows, 10 sheep and 1 horse, the monthly income from milk sales is around 5,000 som.  In order to continue growing her business Mistehan turned to Bai-Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 1 dairy cow and 1 colt to increase earnings from milk delivery.  Mistehan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock count and in the near future plans to build a house and have her son get married.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and a colt

loans.name: Carmen Griselda

texts.es: Carmen de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos. Ella una señora muy alegre y amable, la cual posee muy buenas referencias por parte de sus amigos y vecinos, ya que se destaca por ser alguien responsable y respetuosa, la cual siempre ha trabajado junto a su esposo por sacar adelante su hogar. Carmen posee una tienda en la cual comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, en la cual ha trabajado durante años para poder surtirla y de esta forma obtener todos los beneficios posibles de su negocio. Es por esto que Carmen, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con los recursos necesarios para comprar muchos más productos comestibles como: pan, golosinas, huevos y otros más, de los cuales son los que más se venden, así mismo comprar productos de primera necesidad para el hogar. Todo esto es con el fin de mejorar las ganancias obtenidas por la tienda y así poseer un negocio más rentable y brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children.  She is a very happy and friendly woman who has good references from her friends and neighbors.  She is someone who is responsible and respected and who is always working with her husband to get the family ahead.  Carmen has a store where she sells all types of primary needs products and where she has worked for years to be able to stock it.  In this way she is able to obtain all the possible benefits for her business.

Carmen is asking for a loan so that she can have the resources she needs to buy more merchandise such as bread, snacks, eggs, and other things which are the things she sells the most.  In this way she will be able to buy more items for the home.  All this is so that she can improve her store and have a more profitable store and also provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Francisca continúa dedicándose a la preparación y venta de Ceviche, plato emblemático de la cocina Peruana elaborado a base de pescado fresco y limón. Francisca en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para pagar los estudios de educación de sus 2 hijos, uno de ellos estudiante universitario y el otro en colegio. Francisca está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representa su principal  ingreso económico y la posibilidad de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Francisca is a member of the “QORICHUSPAS” communal bank in the city of Cusco – Peru.  She continues to prepare and sell Ceviche; an emblematic Peruvian dish made with fresh fish and lemon.  Francisca is using this opportunity to request a loan so that she can pay for her two children’s university and school educations.  Francisca is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to develop her financial activity, which represents her main income and the possibility to offer her children an education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar, 52, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as a carpenter for a private company, and his wife weaves traditional Mongolian dresses that are made to order. His elder daughter works as a manager in a restaurant while his second daughter works for a construction company. In 2012, Batbayar demolished his old house in order to build a 2-flat house. At the moment, the house’s second flat is not completed and needs interior work. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy hardwood floors and install doors that will be used to segregate the rooms. The completed house, which  will lose less heat, will be very beneficial to the family and also to the environment, as the consumption of coal will diminish drastically.

loans.use: to buy hardwood floors and install doors

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo san antonio, gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que todas las miembros ponen estan saliendo adelante. La Sra. Laura es parte de este grupo, tiene tres hijos, 2 todavía son pequeños y una mayor que ya trabaja.
Laura tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano. Gracias a su negocio da a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan, y hoy ya recibe la ayuda de uno de ellos. La meta de siempre de Laura ha sido poder hacer que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien para que no tengan que pasar necesidades como las que ella pasó.
Laura solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, ya que quiere poder surtirse con buena variedad de productos para la navidad que se acerca.
texts.en:
Thanks to the effort and determination of all of the members, the San Antonio Group is prospering.  Mrs. Laura is a part of this group.  She has three children, two are still minors and one is of legal age and already works.  Laura has a well stocked pantry in which she works every day from early in the morning.  Thanks to her business, she gives her children everything they need and today she receives help from one of them.  

Laura's goal has always been to make her kids study and to be good people so that they don't have to go through the hardships that she went through.  Laura is asking for this credit in order to buy supplies for her pantry.  She wants to be able to stock a good variety of products for the coming Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to stock the pantry

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 40 años de edad, junto a su esposo y cinco hijos, por los cuales ha trabajado muy duro por sacarlos adelante. María es una mujer muy trabajador, la cual ha luchado mucho por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, desde hace muchos años atrás que ella se ha dedicado a trabajar haciendo tortillas, puesto el cual esta ubicado en su casa lo  cual es de mucho beneficio. Las tortillas son un alimento que los salvadoreños consumen diariamente, razón por la que es un negocio muy rentable, en el cual se puede generar muy buenas ganancias. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de masa para elaborar más tortillas, así mismo desea poder comprar una plancha, nombre que se le da a las cocinas especiales para hacer tortillas. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a María ya que a través del crédito solicitado a INTEGRAL ella espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, lives with her husband and 5 children.  She has worked very hard in order to support them.  Maria is a very hardworking woman who has struggled a lot to provide her children with everything they need.  For many years, she has been working making tortillas. She works from her home, which is very beneficial for her.  Tortillas are a food the the Salvadorans consume daily, and for this reason her business is very profitable.  She is able to generate very good earnings from the business.  

Maria is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of cornflour to make more tortillas.  She also wants to buy a special kind of griddle used to make tortillas.  Maria is filled with enthusiasm, because through this loan that she is requesting from INTEGRAL, she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen supplies to make tortillas

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 54, a resident of Intramuros, a district in Manila, Philippines. She is married to Melanio, a security guard, and she is a mother to her children. Lorna, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lorna maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct sales catalogue, selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. 

Direct sales works as follows. A customer's order is bought in cash by a dealer (e.g., Lorna) and then the product is given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s costs are lower than the prices shown in the catalogue -- the difference between the dealer's cost and the catalogue price represents the profit that dealers generate as their income. 

Lorna's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Lorna is requesting a 10000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lorna hopes to give her children a good, quality education and she dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members where she can share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her direct sales business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.es:
La señora Stella tiene 51 años de edad, es separada, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Villarrica. Es artesana y ofrece servicios de bordado en lienzo y ao poi, tiene su casa propia que con mucho sacrificio y ayuda de sus hijos pudo construir, además construyo dos salones frente a su casa, cuenta que su sueño es poder alquilar esos salones. Stella es una persona con mucha visión y quiere seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante.
Solicito el crédito para poder construir una escalera en su salón, y de esa forma va a poder tener en condiciones su local para alquilar, de esta manera ella va a poder mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir su objetivo para seguir ayudando a su familia. La señora agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señora Stella is 51 years old. She is separated. She lives with her parents in the city of Villarrica. She is an artisan and offers embroidery services on linen and on fine fabric. She has her own house, which she was able to construct with great sacrifice and with the help of her children. In addition, she constructed two rooms in front of her house. She says that her dream is to be able to rent these rooms. Stella is a person with a lot of vision, and she wants to continue working and advancing.

She is applying for the loan to be able to construct a staircase in her room, and by doing this she is going to be able to have her premises in condition to rent. In this way she is going to be able to improve her income and fulfill her goal to continue helping her family. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, since it will be a lot of help to her.

loans.use: to put two rooms into condition to rent

loans.name: Nidia Elizabeth

texts.es: Nidia de 24 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de mejorar en la vida y tener un futuro mejor. Nidia se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, la cual le permite aportar para los gastos familiares ya que ella vive junto a sus padres, por lo que ella desde hace más de 5 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote. Nidia  solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa e iniciar también con la venta de ropa interior femenina que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con   más clientes y así mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su mayor deseo.
texts.en:
Nidia is 24 years old and an enterprising young woman with a great desire to improve in life and have a better future. Nidia sells clothing for women and men, which allows her to contribute to the household expenses, as she lives with her parents. She has been engaged in this occupation for more than five years, and has many regular customers with which she is able to keep her business going. 

Nidia is requesting a loan that will enable her to buy a greater quantity of clothing and also to start selling women's underwear, which is in great demand by many people. She will be able to acquire it at various prices, styles, and colors, and this way have more customers and improve her sales, which is her greatest desire.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
José Emilio vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, se caracteriza por ser una persona luchadora de buenas costumbres morales, tiene a su cargo tres personas. El se desempeña como conductor desde hace cinco años en una institución del estado. 
  
El crédito que está solicitando a CEPRODEL es para comprar materiales de construcción como cerámica, boom, pago de mano de obra y así poder poner el piso, para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.

Con el primer financiamiento que le fue otorgado, pudo avanzar  un poco en mejorar su casa para el bienestar y el desarrollo económico de su familia.
texts.en:
José Emilio lives in Managua, Nicaragua and is known for being a hardworking person of good moral character.  He has three people to support and has been working as a driver for the state for five years.

He will use the money from the loan he is requesting through CEPRODEL to buy building materials such as ceramic tiles and to pay for labor so that he can have the floor installed in his house.  He want to be able to give his family better living conditions.

He used the money from the first loan to make some other improvements for his family’s wellbeing and financial development.

loans.use: to install a tile floor in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. She is from Capucao, Ozamis City and been farming for 8 years, earning an income of 3,000 PHP a month. Recently, Juvelyn joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Fortaleza está en su cuarto ciclo, gracias al gran empeño de todas las integrantes, son 20 mujeres, y aunque es un grupo numeroso, todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto y ayuda mutua.
Elva, una de las miembros vende helados, esta creciendo gracias a este trabajo. Le va bien, según comenta ella misma, ya que siempre hay buen clima para las ventas, y como sus helados son muy ricos, ya se hizo de muy buena clientela. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y tener un gran local de helados.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados, para tener una buena cantidad de su producto y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to the great effort of all of the members, Fortaleza is in its fourth loan cycle.  Even though this is a large group, there are 20 women, they all work in an environment of respect and mutual aid.  

Elva is one of the members that sells ice cream.  She is prospering thanks to this job.  Everything is going well, according to her comment, considering that there is always good weather for sales.  Since her ice cream is delicious, she has really good customers.  

Her goal is to continue growing and to have a great ice cream business.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy ice cream so that she can have a good amount of her product and continue giving her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell

loans.name: Telma De Jesus

texts.es: Telma de 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija quien se dedica a estudiar en la universidad gracias a los esfuerzos de sus padres. Con el deseo de poder brindarle ayuda a su esposo y así mismo aportar con todos los gastos del hogar, desde hace 2 años y medio que Telma inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación así mismo elabora tortillas para vender. Telma atiende el negocio de lunes a domingo, su faena inicia cada día a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche es un trabajo muy duro pero que le permite tener una vida digna. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas, así mismo comprar maíz para la elaboración de más tortillas.
texts.en: Telma is 54 years old. She lives with her husband and a daughter who is studying at the university, thanks to the efforts of her parents. With the desire to be able to offer help to her husband and at the same time contribute to the household expenses, Telma began her own business two and a half years ago. Her business is a store for perishable products, which is located in her home. At the same time, she makes tortillas to sell. Telma tends to the business from Monday to Sunday. Her chores begin each day at 6 am and end at 9 pm. It is very hard work, but it allows her to have a dignified life. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan, with which she can invest by buying a larger quantity of basic products and in this way improve her sales. At the same time, she will buy corn to prepare more tortillas.

loans.use: to buy basic products for her store

loans.name: Udaakhtsetseg

texts.en: Udaakhtsetseg, 21, lives with her family in Dornod, an eastern province of Mongolia. From 2007 to 2009, she attended university as an exterior and interior design major. In 2010, she worked as a waitress but shortly thereafter (in 2011) she was promoted to bookkeeper. As winter comes to Mongolia, it is very troublesome to have a house with a vulnerable roof, so Udaakhtsetseg is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT, which is needed for interior and exterior repair of the house. As a result of these repairs her home will be fixed and no longer lose its heat. This will contribute to environmental protection because the family will burn less coal, and will also provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Estero Camba Group

texts.es:
El comité Estero Camba con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentra en el 3 ciclo, donde cada una de sus miembros se esfuerza al máximo y demuestran que trabajando se puede lograr todo lo que uno se propone.
Una historia es la de la Sra. Geronima quien se dedica a la venta de carne, naranjas y mil de caña, comidas, etc. Como se puede ver la Sra. Geronimia hace todo tipo de actividades, y por medio de esto se gana día a día su pan y el de su familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora que está orgullosa de lo que hace por ser un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en insumos para hacer las comidas que vende, y así seguir deleitando a sus clientes con sus ricas comidas. Geronima y su grupo agradecen por la gran oportunidad que reciben, ya que con esto crecerán y ayudaran a los suyos.
texts.en:
The Estero Camba Committee is in its third cycle where every one of its members puts forth maximum effort and demonstrates that she can achieve everything asked of her.

One story is that of Geronima, who sells meat, oranges, milled sugar cane, food, etc.  As we can see she does all types of things and earns her daily bread for herself and her family.  She is a hardworking, enterprising worker who is proud of what she does.  It’s dignified work and above all, honest. 

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy ingredients for the food she sells.  In this way she will be able to continue providing delicious foods to her customers.  Geromina and her group are grateful for the grand opportunity they are getting.  This helps them grow and help themselves.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza previously accessed a loan of 14,000 PHP that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business budgets. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Riza dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to always have the strength to do her work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for hog feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married mother of two children and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugar cane, raising pigs, selling ready to wear clothing and retailing rice. Lorena is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, spices and eggs for her general store.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, spices and eggs.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en: Davaadorj is 26 years old and lives with his wife and daughter, who is 3 years old. The family lives in Dornod, an eastern province of Mongolia. He has been working as a police officer the last seven years. His wife is a contract worker in the national registration office. In 2009, he purchased a plot of land and built his own home. But the fences along the sides of the house have been damaged over time. Also, the house needs some interior renovation and a new furnace. So, he is requesting the loan of 1500000 MNT to buy a furnace, textiles and planks. As a result, he can repair his house and it will enable the family to live in a comfortable place. Also, the house won’t lose its heat so the family will burn less coal, contributing to environmental improvement.

loans.use: to buy a furnace, textiles and planks for his house.

loans.name: Hezel

texts.en: Hezel is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Hezel grows coconuts and bananas to sell and has been doing this for six years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. Hezel is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to obtain farm fertilizer. Hezel joined GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a 34-year-old married mother of three children. She is living in Capucao, Ozamis City, where she cultivates coconuts. She has been farming this land for six years and normally earns PHP 15,000 a month. Earlier this year, Tessie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay farm maintenance costs. When the crop is harvested, she will use the extra revenue from the loan to expand the planting area to earn more income and to help meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to pay farm maintenance costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more inventory needed in her business.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenetsetseg, 24 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She is a second grade student at university and at the same time she works as teller in supermarket. She has already worked for this company over four years and the company owner has an interest in employing her as an accountant after her graduation. The family lives in house and it has become heavily damaged over time. Also this year her sister will live separately as she is married. So she is requesting the loan of 5,500,000 MNT to buy construction materials and a five-walled traditional Mongolian home for her sister. 

As a result, they can repair and insulate their home and her sister can live, with her husband, in brand new Mongolian traditional five-walled home. The traditional home and fixed house will reduce the consumption of coal the family uses and it will emit less smoke to the environment.

loans.use: to repair her home and buy a five-walled Mongolian home.

loans.name: Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group

texts.en:
After they successfully repaid the previous loan, Ni Kadek and the Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah group decided to continue the loan and each getting 1.5 million IDR. Ni Kadek is fully supported by her husband because it was considered beneficial to the family's economy.

Ni Kadek, who has two children, plans to use this loan to buy four piglets and use her own capital to buy enough pig feed for six months.

Ni Kadek is hoping to gain more profit than the previous loan. The loans help Ni Kadek to develop the business and, of course, increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy four piglets.

loans.name: Samalaulu

texts.en: Samalaulu is 57 years old and married with eight children. She has a plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Samalaulu needs a loan to buy equipment, taro plants, banana trees and fertilizer for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Samalaulu will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, a shovel, gloves, a wheel barrow, and taro plants for her farm.

loans.name: Soli

texts.en: Soli is 60 years old and married with nine children. She has a plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Soli needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a shovel, a wheel barrow, gloves, and taro plants. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Soli will use the profits from her sales to purchase new land to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Faimafili

texts.en: Faimafili is 26 years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a business venture creating different design of clothes and selling them in her community. She has three-years of experience in this line of business. Faimafili needs a loan to buy tools and materials for her business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business in the future. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy fabric material, pack of needles, threads, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru:
Абдуманон мужчина в возрасте 60 лет. Он родился в сельской местности. Женат и имеет 5 детей. Двое сыновей работают на рынке развозят продукты питания . Супруга домохозяйка. Занимается воспитанием детей но в свободное время старается помогать мужу по откармливанию скота. 
  Абдуманон занимается мелкими ремонтами домов , но в основном занимается разведением скота. Этот вид деятельности по его словам дает очень хороший доход. Откармливанием скота Абдуманон занимается более 10 лет.Он очень положительный и добросовестный человек. 
 На полученный кредит Абдуманон планирует купить корм для скота. Так как сейчас зима а свежей травы не где нет ему приходится покупать корм в больших количествах и хочет запастись на зиму.
