This is due to the many "chocolatadas" (a traditional event where chocolate milk and Christmas cake are served) that are held for children of various institutions. That's why he wishes to stock up with this product and thefore increase his profits during this season.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa (powdered chocolate) by quintales (100-kilogram units).

loans.name: Clémentine Honorine

texts.fr: Clémentine est une femme de 34 ans fiancée. Elle a ouvert un café-restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 02 ans déjà dans un marché de la capitale. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'acheter de produits de restauration(alvéoles d'oeufs, petit matériel de café, spaggetti...pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses ventes ainsi que son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activté.
texts.en: Clémentine is a 34-year-old woman who is engaged to be married. She opened a café-restaurant that she has been running for two years already at a market in the capital. Thanks to it, she is taking care of her family. Since she purchases restaurant supplies at the retail level, she does not really earn much, thus the importance of this loan, since it will enable her to purchase restaurant supplies (trays of eggs, sundry items, spaghetti…) for cooking her meals. Then, daily trips can be avoided, and taxi costs can be reduced. Her sales will also increase, as well as her profits. She will reinvest part of her profits in her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of restaurant supplies (eggs, coffee items, spaghetti...)

loans.name: Bernadette France

texts.fr: Frnace est une femme mariée de 37 ans mère de famille. Elle fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a un bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Elle souhaiterai acheter des des sacs de maniocs, de noix de palmes et les régimes de plantains  pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bernadette France is a 37-year-old woman who is a mother with a family. She has been a retailer of staple foods (cassava, plantains, palm nuts, and fruit), depending on the season, at the local market for ten years. She knows suppliers wells, as well as her customers in particular, whom she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

She would like to purchase sacks of cassava, palm nuts, and bunches of plantains to have a good inventory. This will enable her to satisfy the constant customer demand and to avoid inventory shortages. She will save her profit not only for expanding her business but also for meeting the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, palm nuts, and plantains

loans.name: Susi

texts.en:
Susi is 27 years old and married, with one child. She wants to start a small business, making and selling ice blocks in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase supplies. 

In the future, Susi hopes to expand her business to earn more money, then look for another step. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make and sell ice blocks in her community.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three sons and two daughters. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past 10 years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors, and she is famous for providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family.

She has applied for a loan of 15,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She is satisfied from the support of Kashf foundation. Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed. She wishes to use part of profits on her husband's health.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 63 years old, widowed, and has six children. She lives in Guingona, Ozamis City. Caridad owns a plot of farm land, cultivating coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 25 years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. 

Caridad is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase farm chemicals. She is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Caridad's plan is to save her returns for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en:
Iuni is a 35-year-old, married woman with five children. She would like to start growing taro crops (e.g., yams, bananas) to earn a living. 

Iuni has requested a loan to get all equipment needed for her business. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) for two years. Iuni will spend her profits to help with her children's education and to support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy all equipment needed to grow taro crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Moeava

texts.en: Moeava is a 55-year-old, married woman with 2 children. She would like to start growing yams, bananas, taro, etc. to earn a living. Moeava has requested a loan to purchase equipment. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Moeava will spend her profits to provide her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy boots, grass sprayer, bush knife and wheel barrow

loans.name: Lusila

texts.en:
Lusila is a 34-year-old, married woman with four children. She would like to start growing yams, bananas, etc. to earn a living. 

Lusila has requested a loan to buy equipment for her business. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) for two years. Lusila will spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment needed to start growing yams, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es: El Sr. Estanislao tiene 51 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 16  años, El Sr. Estanislao se dedica  a la   fabricación de variedad de Calzados, para damas, tiene su taller en la zona de Queipo de la  ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, El Sr. Estanislao va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una maquina cortadora y materiales como cuero por mayor  para la fabricación de sus calzados  y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de calzados a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Estanislao va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material, El Sr. Estanislao es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Estanislao is 51 years old and has a 16-year-old son. He manufactures a variety of women's shoes. Estanislao owns a shop located in the Queipo area of the city of La Paz. This is his first loan with the institution. Estanislao will use this loan to purchase a cutting machine and supplies such as wholesale leather in order to make his shoes. That way he'll offer a wide variety of footwear to his customers. The reason why he requests this loan is to keep on improving his business. Estanislao will use his profits to continue buying various supplies. He's a very hardworking person who feels glad to have been given this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a cutting machine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 21 years old and married. She is from Panta-on, Ozamis City. She has 1 child who has helped her in taking care of their bananas. They have been raising bananas for 2 years and earn 3,000 PHP a month. Just recently, Josephine joined GDMPC. Josephine requested a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer, and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and for weeding costs.

loans.name: Leleiga

texts.en: Leleiga is a 19-year-old, single woman with 1 child. She would like to start growing taro, yams, bananas, etc. to earn a living. Leleiga has requested a loan to buy equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Leleiga will spend her profits to help provide her family needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, bush knife, wheel barrow and boots.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina tiene 45 años, lleva gran parte de su vida al lado de su esposo Emidigio. Tiene tres hijos, y juntos habitan en una vivienda construida a base de adobe que heredó de sus padres. Desde hace 30 años se dedica al trabajo en el campo, especialmente en la siembra de cacao, siendo éste su principal sustento del hogar. En todos los años que viene desempeñándose en el campo ha tenido el fiel apoyo de Emidigio con quien paso momentos difíciles a través del tiempo con el único afán de llevar el sustento familiar.
Lo agradable de su labor es posee un terreno muy fértil y eso favorece enormemente en la producción, justificando  así el precio de sus prodcutos. No obstante existe una parte de sus parcelas cuya base de terreno ha cedido, debido a las temporadas de lluvias, obligando a remover gran parte de ella con ayuda de los jornaleros del lugar.
Para continuar con su trabajo, desea seguir contando con mano de obra para el sembrado de nuevos plantas de almácigo de cacao y así como el deshierbo de la maleza en otra parcela donde las mazorcas ya se encuentran en un proceso de crecimiento avanzado y es importante su cuidado. 
Todo el esfuerzo aplicado en su trabajo tienen un objetivo final, que es ahorrar para el futuro de su menor hija quien aún se encuentra finalizando sus estudios secundarios y necesitará todo el apoyo de su madre para cumplir sus sueños de ser una gran profesional. Este es su crédito número 7, se siente muy comprometida con el pago de sus cuotas ya que comenta se caracteriza por ser una persona confiable. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles podrá contratar jornaleros para el sembrado de plantas de cacao y sacar la maleza que están en terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Constantina is 45 years old. She has spent the greater part of her life by the side of her husband Emidigio. She has three children and together they live in a house constructed of adobe that she inherited from her parents.  For 30 years she has dedicated herself to working in the fields, especially to the cultivation of cocoa, since this is the principal livelihood of her household.  In all the years working  in the country, she has had the faithful support of Emidigio with whom there have been hard moments during their time working with eagerness to support their family.  

The good thing about her work is that she possesses very fertile land that greatly favors production, thus justifying the price of her product. 
However, the base of the earth on part of one of her parcels has given way due to the rainy season, obliging her to remove the great part of it with the help of the day laborers.

To continue with her work, she wants to  to contract manual laborers to plant the new nursery of cocoa plants and weed the other parcel where the ears of corn are already in an advanced stage of growth and it is important to care for them. All of the effort put into her work has the same final objective which is to save for the future for her youngest daughter, who is already finishing secondary school, and will need all the support of her mother to achieve her dream of being a great professional. This is her seventh loan. She feels very committed to  making her repayments already since she is a trustworthy person. 

With the 2000 new soles she will be able to hire day laborers to plant the cocoa and weed the agricultural fields.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor, de 41 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó dentro de la comunidad. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo y ganadería, tiene sus propios terrenos de cultivos que ha heredado de sus padres, de esta manera  siembra papa, maíz, habas, arveja, trigo y zanahoria junto a su esposa  que  verifica  en cada mes el crecimiento favorable de sus plantas y ocasionalmente vende sus animales, hubieron momento difíciles para su familia ya que en muchas ocasiones las condiciones climáticas no lo han favorecido, sin embargo no se ha rendido y ha buscado las mejores estrategias para salir adelante, una de ellas de trabajar de manera dependiente mientras su esposa verifica sus plantaciones y cuando llega la temporada de la maduración se reúne con su familia para cosechar y vender  todo lo producido en el mercado local. Pues todas sus inversiones están siempre dirigidas a sus actividades agrícolas. Es su crédito número 6 con MFP,  en esta oportunidad ha solicitado un crédito individual  pero tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal además de que esta agradecido por las oportunidades que ha recibido y promete una vez más ser puntual en sus pagos.
Rober, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Victor, who is forty-one years old, is a hard-working man.  He lives with his wife and their two children.  He takes care of them in the house he inherited within the community.  All his life, he has made a living in farming and in livestock.  He has his own farming lands that he inherited from his parents, and therefore grows potatoes, corn, beans, peas, wheat, and carrots with his wife.  He looks in on his plants every month to see that they are growing well, and occasionally, he also sells his animals.

There were difficult times for his family; there were many occasions when the climate conditions were not favorable.  However, he has not given up and has looked for better strategies in order to continue moving forward.  One of these strategies is to work in a dependent way while his wife checks in on the plantations.  When the ripening season arrives, he gets together with his family in order to harvest the crops and to sell everything in the local market.  

All of his investments are always directed towards his agricultural activities.  This is his sixth loan with MFP.  In this opportunity, he is requesting an individual loan, but he also has a good understanding of a group loan.  He is thankful for the opportunities that he has received and promises once again to be punctual with his payments.

Rober, once receiving the support, will invest the money in buying organic fertilizer to nourish his next crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to nourish his next crops.

loans.name: Fagaoalii

texts.en: Fagaoalii is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year. Fagaoalii has requested a loan to buy flour, oil, a large tin bowl, a large cooking pot and a large frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fagaoalii will improve her business to help her kids' education and her family matters.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and a cooking pot

loans.name: Honorio

texts.es:
Honorio, de 45 años, es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Hortensia y sus 2 hijos a los que quiere mucho y cuida en la casa que le heredó su madre hace un año. Desde niño aprendió el arte de la familia, los tejidos a base de lana de alpaca y vicuña, pues gusta mucho de hilar y trabajar en su maquina artesanal. Tiene años de experiencia en la artesanía, su trabajo y buen gusto le ayudaron a poseer clientes fijos, comenta que los meses de mayor venta son de enero a septiembre, por lo que desea seguir tejiendo para los posteriores meses que se aproximan y carece de lana. Espera poder compra varios kilos de lana procesada y así seguir con el arte que le apasiona. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Honorio, invertirá el dinero en la compra de lanas para realizar sus textiles.
texts.en:
45-year-old Honorio is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife Hortensia and his two children, whom he loves very much and cares for in a house he inherited from his mother a year ago. Ever since he was young, he learned the family's craft, which is weaving fabrics made of alpaca and vicuña wool. He greatly enjoys weaving and working on his traditional craft machine. He has gotten years' worth of experience in craftwork, and his efforts and good taste helped him to build a regular clientele. He reports that the months with the highest sales are January through September. For that reason he wishes to keep on weaving in the upcoming months, and he needs wool. He hopes to be able to buy several kilograms of processed wool and therefore keep up the craft he loves. This is his second loan with MFP. He gives thanks for the financial support he has gotten, because that way he'll move forward with his plans for improving his business. He also pledges to make his repayments in a timely fashion.
Honorio will use the loan to purchase wool for weaving his textiles.

loans.use: to purchase wool of various colors.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush lives in Kapan town with her 20-year-old daughter, who is a student at Yerevan State University and specializes in the field of Russian philology. Anush is an accountant and works at a local company. As she is the only worker in the family, it is very difficult to cover basic costs and at the same time save money for education. So, Ansuh has requested this loan to pay for university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Kalajahuira Ag. 25 Gs Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario KALAJAHUIRA AG. 25 GS está  compuesto por tres integrantes todas mujeres, La  coordinadora del  grupo  es la Sra. Susana tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de legumbres y hortalizas, ella trae de los pueblos cercanos y lo vende en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la Ciudad de La Paz,  Este préstamo es el Segundo que ha tomado de Emprender la Sra.  Susana va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de  mercadería por mayor  como zanahoria, papa, choclo por las épocas de fin de año Su razón para solicitar este préstamo por la falta de capital, Susana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la época de lluvia que esta perjudicado en sobremanera al área agricultura y a las personas que dependen de ella. Los precios han subido y muchas veces la mercadería es escasa y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería, por lo que adelantará el pago a los proveedores para que pueda tener mercadería segura y poder venderla en estas fiestas de fin de año, su deseo para su negocio es ella no tiene un puesto fijo en el mercado, por lo que ella quisiera es poder comprarse un puesto para así poder vender con mayor tranquilidad.
texts.en:
The group Kalajahuira Ag.25 Gs is composed of three members, all women. The group’s coordinator is Mrs. Susana, 45, who has three children. She brings vegetables from neighboring towns and sells them in one of the busiest markets in La Paz.

This is the second loan she receives from Emprender. Mrs. Susana will use it to invest in buying merchandise, such as carrots, potatoes and corn, now that the holidays are coming. She requested this loan because she lacks the capital.

Susana faces challenges like the weather. The rainy season greatly affects the agricultural lands and those that make a living from them.  Prices have risen and there is a shortage of goods many times. She will use the loan to continue buying merchandise, for which she will pay her suppliers in advance, in order to be safe and be able to sell it during the upcoming holidays.

Her dream is to buy her own establishment, since she does not have now a fixed place in the market. In this way, it would be easier for her to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like carrots, potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
This is Ma. Liza, 33, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noli and a mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Liza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Ma. Liza hopes to have a peaceful life and dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Punipuao

texts.en:
Punipuao, a 31-year-old married mother of one, has a small plantation upon which she grows taro crops, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

A member of SPBD since 2008, Punipuao has requested a loan to improve her home living conditions. She also hopes to expand her agricultural output so that she can sell her products to a big company.

loans.use: to purchase a wheel barrow, knives, shovels, new furniture, carpet, and windows.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia de 50 años, comprendió que ante toda adversidad están los hijos primero, es así que con trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos brindándoles una buena ecuación. Comparte sus vivencias en su casa construida a base de madera. Se inició en el trabajo de la agricultura por sus padres, pues desde muy niña participó de las actividades que ellos desempeñaban y desde entonces le sirvió para ganar mucha experiencia y ahora es su principal fuente de ingreso. 
Normalmente recibe el apoyo de sus hijos en tiempos de actividad baja, siendo necesaria la contrata de jornaleros para actividades pesadas y masivas.
Lo reconfortante de su trabajo  es que sus parcelas en época de mantenimiento denotan una apariencia hermosa por el colorido de las hojarascas esparcidas por el suelo, el cual hacen que sea la parte más atractiva de su trabajo.
Iniciada la campaña productiva desea seguir invirtiendo en la producción de sus parcelas, para ello es necesario contar con dinero para la compra de sacos de abono orgánico como el guano de ave, asimismo desea contratar jornaleros quienes realizan labores de injerto con plantas de almácigos y sacar la maleza para garantizar una producción de calidad.
Uno de sus objetivos a largo plazo es que desea aperturar una tienda de abarrotes, para un futuro descansar del trabajo en el campo, ya que es consiente que el ser humano no siempre tendrá las mismas fuerzas para esta ardua labor. Este es su crédito número 13, muestra un profundo agradecimiento por las oportunidades en que su préstamo le ayudó a salir adelante. Se siente muy satisfecha por el trabajo que vienen desarrollando sus compañeros de su banco comunal inspirándole mucha confianza  y motivación.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles otorgados comprará sacos de abono orgánico para optimizar su producción así como la contrata de jornaleros cuyo pago promedia 25 nuevos soles por cada uno al día.
texts.en:
At 50 years old, Lidia knows that, whatever happens, her children come first.  So, with a lot of hard work, she has provided for the family and given her four children a good education.  She shares her experiences in her wooden house.

Lidia started in agriculture because of her parents. Since she was a little girl she had helped them in their work and, later on, having this experience was very useful and is now her principal form of income. In the low season, Lidia normally receives help from her children but needs to hire labourers for the bigger jobs. What she most loves about her work is that, during the upkeep of the plots, the colours of the fallen leaves scattered across the ground look beautiful.

With the production season started, Lidia wants to continue investing in production on the plots, and she needs money to buy bags of organic fertiliser, such as guano (bird droppings).  In addition, she needs to pay the labourers who plant the seeds and that do the weeding to ensure quality products grow on from the plot.

Knowing that she won’t always be strong enough to continue with the physical labour of working in the fields, one of her long term objectives is to open a grocery store, so she can work less in the field.  This is her thirteenth loan and she is incredibly grateful for the opportunities that these loans have given her, helping her to succeed.  She is very satisfied with the work of her colleagues at the communal bank, who have had confidence in her and who have motivated her.

With 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, she will buy organic fertiliser to maximise production and also pay the wages of the labourers, who earn around 25 Peruvian Nuevos Soles a day.

loans.use: Contratar jornaleros y comprar sacos de abono orgánico.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.es:
Con la sonrisa que siempre la caracteriza Nemia de 31 años, es soltera y madre de dos niños, Maycoll  y George. Tiene el orgullo de haber concretado sola su vivienda hecha a base de ladrillo y concreto. Motivada por el deseo de salir delante de manera independiente decidió buscar algún ingreso para el sustento de su familia. Es así que se inicio como aprendiz en un salón de belleza de su barrio y luego de 7 años ha logrado tener su propio salón de belleza, fuera del mercado de su localidad.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo, tiene paciencia y detalle único para con sus clientes que la han valido para ser una de las más queridas en su barrio. Para generar ingresos extras complementa su negocio con la venta de algunas prendas de vestir para damas y calzados de marcas comerciales muy solicitadas. 
Para seguir adelante con su negocio desea contar con capital que le permita invertir en dichos productos. 
Desea a futuro trabajar con el mismo entusiasmo para lograr ampliar su domicilio con un segundo piso e iniciarse en el negocio del alquiler de cuartos. Cuenta hasta el momento con 4 créditos gracias a la confianza de MFP. Es una socia muy activa puesto que aparte de brindar su domicilio para la reunión de su grupo comunal ocupa el cargo de secretaria. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital para la compra de prendas de vestir y calzados para abastecer su segundo negocio el cual desempeña paralelo a su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Nemia always has a smile on her face. She is 31 years old, single and the mother of two children, Maycoll and George. She is proud to have built her house out of bricks and concrete, all by herself. Motivated to succeed on her own, she decided to look for some way to make a living so she could support her family. This is how she became an apprentice at a beauty salon in her neighborhood; then, seven years ago, she was able to start her own beauty salon, outside of the local market. She likes her work very much, is patient and pays attention to detail with her clients, who think of her as one of the most beloved individual in her neighborhood.
In order to generate additional income, she also sells women's wear and shoes from popular brands. For her business to prosper, she hopes to raise the capital that will allow her to invest in these products. She wishes to work in the future with as much enthusiasm as before, so she can expand her home, build a second floor and start renting rooms. She has received 4 loans thanks to MFP. She is a very active member : not only does she lend her home for group meetings, but she also works as secretary for the group. With the 1,000 soles, she will increase her capital so that she can purchase clothes and shoes to stock her second line of business - which she operates in conjunction with her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es:
Feliza, de 45 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive junto a su esposo Wilfredo y sus 2 hijos: Henry y Noemi, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 25 años. Desde hace 5 años apertura su tienda de comestibles la parte delantera de su casa, que queda en la plaza de su pueblo, desde entonces lleva brindando el servicio de venta de comestibles de toda variedad, este trabajo le ayudó a juntar dinero y a muchos gastos del hogar. Ahora desea seguir trabajando como siempre, pues su hija se encuentra estudiando y carrera universitaria, por eso desea aprovechar la temporada navideña para poder vender todo lo que pueda y obtener buenas ganancias. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Feliza, invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en: Forty-five year old Feliza is an unassuming woman.  She lives with her husband, Wilfredo and their two children, Henry and Noemi, and looks after them all in the house that she bought 25 years ago.  For five years, she has had her food shop in the front part of her house, which is on the main square in her town.  For five years, she has been selling all types of foodstuffs and this work helped her save money and pay many household bills.  Now she would like to continue working as always.  Her daughter is studying at university and Feliza would like to take advantage of the Christmas period so that she can sell all she can and make a good profit.  This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very grateful for the financial support they have given her as it will help her to continue with her plans to improve her business.  She also promises to make her repayments on time.  Feliza will use the loan to buy bags of rice and sugar for her food store.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Jerrly

texts.es:
Jerrly, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de amable y alegre, es conviviente con Ander quien es comerciante. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos de 6, 3 y 1 año de edad, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que desempeña Jerrly es la agricultura tiene un terreno de 10 hectáreas de extensión la cual compró hace 12 años, ahi siembra productos como maíz y plátanos, siendo su producto principal el cacao ya que esa zona es propicia para éste producto, siendo estos vendidos en el mercado local, teniendo bastante demanda. Por tanto, trabaja de manera rigurosa en la cosecha, por ello contrata a 2 peones a los que paga por día de trabajo, 30 nuevos soles cada uno.
Le gusta la agricultura, inicialmente se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio ya que comenta que de jovencita tuvo muchas dificultades de conseguir trabajo pues no completó sus estudio segundarios. Actualmente se siente conforme con su vida en el campo ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y le permite llevar una vida tranquila y con muchos planes como por ejemplo tiene planes de incursionar en la palma aceitera ya que éste producto está en auge y tiene bastante demanda. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido con la ayuda financiera para avanzar con sus planes.  Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de cacao, para aumenta la productividad de éste grano.
texts.en:
Jerrly, 25, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being kind and cheerful.  Her spouse is Ander, a merchant, and she lives in her own house with him and their children whose ages are 6, 3, and 1.  Jerrly’s activity is agriculture.  He has a 10-hectare parcel she bought 12 years ago when she arrived from her native land of Roboya.  She grows such things as bananas and corn and her main crop is cocoa beans since this zone is particularly apt for this product.  She then sells in the local markets and has quite a bit of demand.  To harvest, she hires two laborers that she pays a daily wage of 30 new soles each.

She likes agriculture.  Initially she opted for this activity because she needed to have an occupation and she comments that when she was young it was very difficult to find a job because she never completed secondary school.  She’s currently satisfied with her life in the fields because it’s provided her with much satisfaction and allows her to live a tranquil life.  She has many plans.  For example, she plans to start growing palm oil palms because this products in on the upswing and has very high demand.  

As a result, this will be MFP loan #5.  She’s grateful for the financial help to move her plans forward.  She’s also very comfortable in her communal bank because she knows her fellow members and considers them to be kind, responsible people.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to buy cacao seeds in greater amounts because she wants to expand her cocoa bean crops.

loans.use: Comprar semilla de cacao.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: José Camilo

texts.es:
José Camilo tiene 24 años, es originario de Quibdó (Colombia) la ciudad capital del Chocó, el departamento con mayores índices de pobreza y menos desarrollado del país.  Se graduó de Ciencia Política en la Pontificia Universidad Javeriana, donde por 8 semestres, y gracias a su rendimiento académico, estuvo becado.

Actualmente hace parte del cuadro directivo de La Ciudad Verde, un colectivo ciudadano donde promueven el desarrollo sostenible en ciudades y regiones de Colombia. En la Universidad fue presidente de Afrojaverianos, una fraternidad que reúne a los estudiantes afrodescendientes de la Universidad Javeriana. Es columnista invitado en varios medios de comunicación donde escribe sobre democracia, política y desarrollo. El prestigioso diario El Espectador o nomino como uno de los “jóvenes afrocolombianos más destacados”. 

Quiere hacer estudios de posgrado en el exterior, para adquirir conocimientos y experiencias que le permitan contribuir mejor a Colombia. José Camilo considera que los estudios en el exterior, permiten a la personas acercarse a los problemas desde la confluencia de muchas miradas que fortalecen el criterio personal a través  de la deliberación respetuosa. José cursará una maestría en Estudios Latinoamericanos en la Universidad de Newcastle, donde según él, podrá comprender los problemas de la región desde una nueva perspectiva y, al terminar sus estudios, contribuir de manera creativa y responsable al desarrollo de Colombia y de la región latinoamericana.

Aquí está su historia:

Nací en el Chocó, un departamento de Colombia poseedor de gran riqueza en flora, fauna y recursos naturales. Uno de los lugares con mayor biodiversidad del mundo. Pero también, el departamento con los más bajos índices de desarrollo económico, altas de tasas de analfabetismo y gran desigualdad. Yo hago parte de una nueva generación de chocoanos, que tuvieron la oportunidad de educarse en buenas universidades y que ahora quieren hacer las cosas bien para el desarrollo sostenible de mi región. Contribuir a buscar ese balance deseado entre la conservación del medio ambiente, la equidad social y el desarrollo económico.

Estoy muy agradecido por el privilegio que he tenido, gracias al esfuerzo de mis padres.  Es por eso que deseo usar mis oportunidades para contribuir al cambio de mi región y ayudar a mejorar la situación de los colombianos en general. Soy de los qu piensa que un país nunca alcanzará el desarrollo y el progreso cuando hay desigualdad entre las regiones que lo conforman y entre las personas que lo habitan. 

Mi curiosidad académica y sed por contribuir a nuestra sociedad me han animado a cursar estudios de posgrado en el exterior. Esta ha sido la razón por la cual solicité admisión en el programa de Estudios Latinoamericanos Interdisciplinarios de la Universidad de Newcastle en Inglaterra. 

Obtener el apoyo de KIVA significaría tener el impulso fundamental en mi camino para alcanzar ese sueño de continuar con mi formación académica, para poder ser un profesional útil que aporta en el crecimiento y desarrollo sostenible de América Latina como región.
texts.en:
José Camilo is 24 years old and is originally from Quibdó (Colombia), the capital city of Chocó, the department with the largest poverty index and the least developed of the country. He graduated in political science from Pontificia Universidad Javeriana, where he studied for 8 semesters, and thanks to his academic achievement, was a scholarship holder.

Currently he is part of the management of La Ciudad Verde [The Green City], a caring collective where they promote sustainable development in cities and regions of Colombia. In university he was the president of Afrojaverianos, a fraternity that reunites students of African descent at Universidad Javeriana. He is an invited columnist in various communication medias where he writes about democracy, politics and development. The prestigious daily El Espectador [The Spectator] nominated him as one of the "most outstanding young afro-colombians."

He wants to do postgraduate studies outside the country, to gain knowledge and experiences that would allow him to better contribute to Colombia. José Camilo considers that studies outside the country allow people to come closer to the problems from the confluence of many looks that strengthen personal views through respectful deliberation. José will study a Master's in Latin-American Studies at the University of Newcastle, where according to him, he will be able to understand the problems of the region from a new perspective and, at the end of his studies, contribute to the development of Colombia and the latin-american region in a creative and responsible manner.

Here is his story:

I was born in Chocó, a department of Colombia possessing a great richness in flora, fauna and natural resources. One of the places with the most biodiversity in the world. But also, the department with the lowest economic development indexes, high rates of illiteracy and great inequalities. I am part of a new generation of Chocoanos, who had the opportunity of educating ourselves in good universities and who now want to make things good for the sustainable development of my region. To contribute to search for this desired balance between conservation of the environment, social equality and economic development.

I am very grateful for the privilege that I have had, thanks to the efforts of my parents. It's because of this that I want to use my opportunities to contribute to the change of my region and help to improve the situation of Colombians in general. I am part of those who think that development and progress will never start in a country when there are inequalities between the regions that make it up and between the people that live there.

My academic curiosity and thirst to contribute to our society have encouraged me to take postgraduate studies outside the country. This has been the reason for which I am requesting admission in the interdisciplinary latin-american studies program at the University of Newcastle in England.

Obtaining the support of Kiva would signify having the funadmental boost in my path to begin this dream of continuing with my academic formation, to be able to be a useful professional who contributes to the growth and sustainable development of Latin America as a region.

loans.use: to finance the application expenses for his Master's in interdisciplinary latin american studies.

loans.name: Abbe

texts.fr: Abbe est une femme mariée de56 ans mère de famille. Elle fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes, tomates, gombo et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a un bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Elle souhaiterai acheter un pick up de régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abbe is a 56 year old married woman with a family. She has been selling seasonal fresh food (cassava, plantains, palm nuts, tomatoes, okra and assorted fruits) in a local market for the past ten years. Abbe has a good relationship with her suppliers, as well as with the customers that she has acquired over time due to her experience as a merchant.

Abbe hopes to use this loan to purchase bunches of plantains. This will allow her to increase her stock of goods, and thus better meet the demand of her customers. She will also be better able to avoid having her merchandise be out of stock. Abbe plans to save her income in order to expand her business and to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bunches of plantains for resale.

loans.name: Faleseesee

texts.en: For the past year Faleseesee, a 35-year-old married mother of two, has been running a small business selling ice cakes and pancakes in her community. Having joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital, she has requested a loan to buy flour, oil, gas ovens, cordials, flavors, sugar, and plastic bags. With her earnings, Faleseesee will expand her business to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, flavors, sugar, and cordials.

loans.name: Antoliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Antoliana tiene 51 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2  hijos y vive en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Ella tiene una Despensa bien surtida.
Cuenta la Sra. Antoliana que se inició con un copetín, y después cambio de rubro que es su despensa, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad.
Solicita el crédito para las compras de insumos para su negocio, como ser bebidas, enlatados, verduras y demás, ya que son los que más salida tiene. Ella agradece por la ayuda que recibe, pues le será de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
Antoliana, 51, is married, has two children, and lives in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  She has a well-stocked grocery store.  She says she started with a small store and later changed areas and now has her grocery store.  It has gone very well for her, with regular customers because of longevity.

She's requesting the loan to buy beverages, canned goods, vegetables, and other supplies for her business because these are the most popular.

She's grateful for the help she gets because it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, vegetables, and other supplies

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 29 years old. She is married and has five children. Their names are Praise (12 years old), Promise (10 years old), Porin (8 years old), Precious (4 years old) and Province (11 months old). Her husband builds village houses for a living.

Betty is a farmer and a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar energy products to their communities. As a Solar Sister, Betty has learned marketing and business skills. 

Betty uses the money she earns as a Solar Sister to take care of her five children. She uses the money for school fees and providing meals for the family.

Her dream is to be a strong businesswoman and to make enough money to be able to educate all of her children. She also dreams of owning a big shop where she can sell many Solar Sister lanterns.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 47 years old. She is a single mother. She has six biological children and has two additional children whom she adopted after her sister passed away. In total, she has five boys and three girls.

Harriet is a full-time housekeeper. She cooks and also helps take care of the five grandchildren of her employer. According to her friends, she is a fantastic cook.

Harriet is also a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar-powered products to their communities. She uses the profits that she earns as a Solar Sister to pay the school fees of her youngest children. 

With this Kiva loan, Harriet will purchase more solar inventory that she will then resell to her community.

Harriet dreams of building her own house someday.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old. She is a single mother with two children. She has an 11-month-old daughter and a 4-year-old son. She earns her income by selling mobile airtime scratch cards and jewelry that she makes herself. 

Elizabeth is also a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar energy products to their communities. As a Solar Sister, she has learned marketing and business skills. 

With the income she earns as a Solar Sister, Elizabeth hopes to save and buy her own land, save up for her children's school fees and also own a business that employs more people.

Elizabeth's dream is to be a landlord and to save enough money to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lamps to sell in her community.

loans.name: Genard

texts.en:
Genard used his previous loan to buy fertilizer for planting potatoes on his farm. It was profitable, and he was able to pay the loan back well and in good time. Besides farming for cash crops, he also sells livestock.

This will be his fourth loan, and he plans to buy livestock which he will later sell. This being a festive season, he anticipates to make more profits with which he will later buy more livestock.

He hopes to expand his business by selling livestock in other parts of Olkalau town.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es: Constantina, de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive con su esposo Víctor y sus 2 hijos: Talia y Judith; a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 3 años. Ella es una madre y esposa ejemplar, junto a su esposo trabajan todos los días por el bienestar de la familia. Su trabajo consiste en el traslado de diversos productos, como tierra, leche, leña y demás cosas que le requieran sus clientes, su principal instrumento de trabajo es la motocicleta que posee. Por lo que sacó trabajo y ahorró muy duro para poder comprarse una, “antes solo alquilaba una motocicleta, pero ahora ya tengo una propia”, menciona. Es por esa razón que le falta un porcentaje de dinero para terminar de cancelar la motocicleta y poder trabajar tranquila y así obtener mayor ingreso económico. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Constantina, invertirá el dinero en la pago de su motocicleta, pues le falta muy poco para poder cancelar.
texts.en: Constantina, 37 years old, is a working woman.  She lives with her husband Victor and their two children, Talia and Judith.  She looks after them in the house that she bought three years ago.  She is a model mother and wife, and alongside her husband she works every day for the well-being of her family.  Her work consists of delivering products, such as soil, firewood and other products that her customers need moving.  Her main tool at work is her motorcycle.  To buy it she had to work and save very hard: "before I only rented a motorcycle but now I have my own", she says.  She is now just a bit short of paying off the motorcycle and of being able to work in peace and earn more money.  This is her third loan with MFP and she is grateful for the financial support they have given her.  With it she will be able to continue with her plans to improve her business. She also promises to make her repayments on time.  Constantina will invest the loan in paying off her motorcycle as she does not have much left to pay.

loans.use: to complete payments on her motorcycle

loans.name: Alatasi

texts.en: Alatasi is a 56-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yam, bananas, and other plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Alatasi has requested a loan to buy more equipment and to improve her living conditions. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. With her profits, Alatasi hopes to provide her family and her community with good products from her business.

loans.use: to buy new furniture, a wheelbarrow, cement, carpet, and a bush knife.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 34-year-old single woman. She has no children of her own, but she is the caretaker of three of her late brother's children. She also takes care of her grandmother. She is a teacher, a counselor and a scout national trainer.

Mary is also a proud Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell portable solar lanterns to their communities. As a Solar Sister, Mary has learned marketing and business skills. 

With the extra income she earns as a Solar Sister, Mary is able to support the orphaned children under her care.

Mary dreams of becoming a superstar in solar product distribution. She would also like to buy cows and construct a permanent house for her grandmother.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old and is married with two daughters. He lives in the town of Kutaisi with his father and his family and he works as a distributor for a private company. As his income is not enough to support his five-member family, George is requesting a loan to start up a business. His request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo that provides loans with soft  credit conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to lines of credit as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

George is requesting a loan to start a second-hand clothing business. He will purchase second-hand clothing from wholesalers abroad and sell them in his community. According to George’s estimations, his project will be profitable and he plans to reinvest the profit from his loan back into his business. He hopes that his family's income will increase and their living conditions will improve. In addition to the above, in case of future need, George's family will have enough income to access regular credit lines available through the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to start a second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 26 years old, married and has a five-month-old son named Malcom. She owns a small retail shop and her husband is a primary school teacher.

Monica is also a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell clean, portable lanterns to their communities. 

"While working with Solar Sister, I have been able to supplement my income," Monica says. "Now I have enough money to at least buy milk for my baby and also his clothing. With the money saved from Solar Sister, my husband and I hope to buy a plot of land for our future home, and also to open up a bigger shop."

Monica's biggest dreams include owning her own home, expanding her shop and being able to go back to school.

She loves Solar Sister because it allows her to start her own business with minimal start-up capital. With this Kiva loan, Monica will purchase more solar inventory that she will then resell to her community.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Las quince mujeres del grupo Virgen de Fátima ya están en su ciclo numero 16. Muestran gran entusiasmo y ponen mucho de ellas en las capacitaciones, ya que tienen un gran espíritu de progreso y lucha.
Noelia la presidenta, lucha por la unión de su grupo, a la vez que también hace sus ventas de ropas, es una persona que muestra un gran espíritu de liderazgo, pues quiere poder ayudar a sus amigas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, para que de esa forma pueda tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientas y clientes.
Todas las miembros están contentas por formar parte del comité, pues aprenden muchas cosas, entre ellas valorarse las unas a las otras.
texts.en:
The fifteen women in the group Virgen de Fátima are now in their 16th loan cycle. They show great enthusiasm and put a lot of themselves into the training, since they have a great spirit of progress and striving.

Noella, the president, works for the unity of her group, at the same time that she also sells clothing. She is a person who shows a great spirit of leadership, since she wants to be able to help her friends.

She is applying for this loan to buy clothing, so that in this way she can have a good variety to offer her customers. 

All the members are happy to form part of the group, since they learn many things, among them, to value one another.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel, es casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive junto a su esposa la cual no trabaja ya que esta delicada de salud, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Cota cota de la ciudad de La Paz.
El trabaja como empleado en una empresa pública por más de ocho horas como consultor, el crédito lo requiere para el pago de un postgrado en 
Administración pública  ya que tiene la posibilidad de un ascenso lo cual implicará una  mejora en  sus ingresos.  Angel es la única persona encargada de cubrir los gastos de alimentación, pago de alquileres y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de Ángel es adquirir un anticrético para ahorrar en los pagos de alquileres, y mejorar su calidad de vida teniendo más comodidad y seguridad.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en: Ángel’s married and has three children who are all independent now.  He lives with his wife who is in poor health and does not work.  They live in a two-bedroom rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Cota Cota zone.  He works as a consultant for a public firm for more than 8 hours daily and needs the loan to pay for a postgraduate degree in Public Administration because he has the opportunity of a promotion that would mean higher income.  Ángel is the only one covering food, rental and basic utility costs.  His dream is to get an ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] so he can save on rental costs and improve his quality of life having more comfort and security.  This is his fourth loan request to IMPRO and second to KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for a postgraduate degree

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luís, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus familiares ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Llojeta en la ciudad de La Paz.
José Luís trabaja como ayudante de albañil por más de ocho horas al día, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de una mezcladora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo por que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de José Luís, es ser maestro albañil, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse, para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: José Luis is single and has no children.  He lives in his family’s house occupying a single bedroom with brick walls; the house is located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone.  José Luis works as a bricklayer’s assistant for more than 8 hours daily and needs the loan to buy a cement mixer because it will be of much help in his work which is very demanding.  With the little he earns he must cover food and basic utility costs.  His dream is to become a master bricklayer to improve his income and be able to become independent to improve his income and his quality of life.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
Danny, es soltero y tiene dos hijas que están en etapa escolar, viven en alquiler ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Periférica de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la copra de una Lap Top, ya que será de mucha ayuda para los estudios de sus hijas, para realizar sus trabajos prácticos.
Danny, trabaja por más de diez horas como chofer asalariado y a veces hasta altas horas de la noche ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El sueño de Danny, es adquirir un anticrético (es una forma legal acordada entre un dueño de casa y un inquilino, donde el primero recibe una suma por adelantado por un periodo no menor a un año y no mayor a dos, permitiendo que el inquilino viva en el departamento o casa, y al cabo de dicho periodo la suma recibida es devuelta al inquilino, quien de be desocupar el inmueble) depara darles más comodidad y seguridad a sus hijas y también poder cubrir sus estudios para que ellas sean profesionales.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Danny’s single and has two school age daughters; they live in a rented, two-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Periférica zone.  He needs the loan to buy a laptop that will be very useful for his daughters’ schooling to do their homework.  Danny works more than ten hours daily as a salaried driver and sometimes into the late night hours since he’s the only one covering food, schooling and basic utility costs for his family.

Danny’s dream is to acquire an ‘anticrético’ (a legal contract between a property owner and a tenant whereby the former received a lump sum in advance for a period of no less than a year and no greater than two years allowing the tenant to live in the apartment or house.  At the end of said period of time, the amount advanced is returned to the tenant who must then vacate the property) to provide more comfort and security for his daughters and also to be able to cover their schooling so they can become professionals.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his daughters.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
La señora Juana Evangelista, es una persona emprendedora y responsable con sus obligaciones, labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco  de la tarde, los siete días de la semana en su negocio venta de tomates, en uno de los mercados capitalinos, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en el negocio, ambos son trabajadores, ella se encarga de la venta y atención de sus clientes  y el esposo realiza las entregas y almacenaje de las cajas de tomates. 

Solicita un préstamo a ceprodel para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de tomates. Esto con el propósito de comprar mas productos, debido a que esta temporada hay bastante demanda de este producto y así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y captar mas compradores.  
 
Agradece  a  Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su negocio  de forma que esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Evangelista’s an enterprising person who is very responsible with her obligations.  She works every day from six in the morning until five in the afternoon seven days a week selling tomatoes in one of the markets in the capital.  She works alongside her husband; they are both hardworking.  She takes care of sales and customer service and her husband does the deliveries and stores the crates of tomatoes.

She’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to invest in working capital to buy tomatoes.  This is with the goal of buying more products because demand is high during this season and she will have more variety on-hand to capture more buyers.  

She thanks Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and the trust placed in her.  She will invest this loan in her business in such a way that she’ll be able to provide sustenance for her home and gradually improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Faalili

texts.en: Faalili is a 38-year-old married woman who has five children. She has a small plantation where she grows yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faalili has requested a loan to buy products to improve the condition of her home. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With the profits from her plantation, Faalili hopes to expand and find more ways to export her goods.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, cement, carpet, and a wheel barrow to make home improvements

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 60 years old. She is a widow and has seven children and fourteen grandchildren. Despite her age, she has not stopped working hard to bring up her children and grandchildren.

Joyce earns her income by selling groundnuts at the roadside. She is also a full-time Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar energy products to their communities. As a Solar Sister, Joyce has learned marketing and business skills.

The additional income that she earns as a Solar Sister has helped Joyce scale her groundnuts business from selling 20 kilograms per week to now selling 200 kilograms of groundnuts per week. 

Joyce uses the money she gets to support her family and buy her children's scholastic materials for school.

Her biggest dream is to become a role model to young girls. Joyce also wants to teach her children to become better business people by introducing them to Solar Sister.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lamps to sell in her community.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 27 years old. She is married and has three children. She is now pregnant with her fourth child. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Jennifer helps to support her family with income earned through agricultural production (especially rice growing). She is also a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell clean, portable solar lanterns in their communities. 

As a Solar Sister, Jennifer has learned marketing and business skills. She uses the extra income for buying scholastic materials for her children, as well as clothing.

Jennifer dreams of becoming a superstar in business and a role model to all the mothers in her village. She wants to make a difference in her community.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en: Melania is a 36-year-old married woman who has one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Melania has requested a loan to buy more equipment for her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Melania hopes to provide her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, a grass sprayer, boots, and a bush knife

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 50 years old and married with four children. For the past five years, she has run a small business where she makes banana and taro chips to sell in her community. Rosalina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital.

Rosalina is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as taro, banana, oil, flavor, and a frying pan to make her chips. She plans to earn more and save her earnings to help her children's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as taro, banana, and oil to make chips

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is widowed and has five children, all of whom currently attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and she also looks after her grandchildren. For the past 15 years, Jane has been selling scrap metal wholesale and she works seven days a week. She has no other source of income. Jane rents a house with access to electricity and no running water and her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent. Her business challenges include transportation. Jane joined MCDT because of their low interest rates.

Jane is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy scrap metal to sell. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy metal scrap to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline Lissette

texts.es: Jacqueline Lissette de 28 anos de edad, casada sin hijos, del departamento de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Y es una ciudad que se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, con gente muy acogedora, trabajadora, responsable, amables. Jacqueline tiene por actividad económica la venta de gaseosas, cosméticos, venta de recarga. Desde hace ocho anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. Negocio que surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingreso que ayude a los gastos del hogar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra y venta de productos como: gaseosas, pintura de labios, lápiz de ojos, rubor, perfumees, body, crema corporal,  vanidades. Jacqueline agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Jacqueline Lissette, 28, is married and has no children.  She’s from León Department, a place located in the western part of the country and a city noted for being a tourist destination with very welcoming, hardworking, responsible, kind residents.  Jacqueline’s economic activity is selling soft-drinks, cosmetics and mobile phone airtime cards.  She’s been in said activity for 8 years.  The business arose because she needed to have a source of income to help with household expenses.  She needs the loan to invest in working capital to stock her business.  She will buy products like lipstick, eyeliner, blush, perfume, body cream and make-up. Jacqueline is grateful for the help Kiva lenders give people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Las Intocables Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LAS INTOCABLES  está compuesta por doce integrantes de los cuales diez  son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Rosalía tiene 31 años, casada tiene dos  hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Pucarani, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosalia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Rosalia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus chompas. En la foto hay trece integrantes ya que una de las socias del banco fue acompañada de su hermana.
texts.en: The “Las Intocables” (The Untouchables) communal bank has 12 members ten of which are women and two are men; they are in different lines of work.  The bank president is Rosalía, 31.  She’s married and has two school age children.  She works knitting sweaters and alpaca blankets for women.  Her workshop is at home located in the Pucarani zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Rosalía will use it to buy alpaca wool at wholesale to knit sweaters and blankets because sales are very good these days.  She delivers orders to various markets in the city of El Alto.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase working capital.  The business challenge Rosalía faces is stocking her merchandise and will use profits to continue buying her supplies for knitting sweaters at wholesale.  Thirteen people appear in the photo because one of the member’s sisters came to the meeting with her.

loans.use: to buy yarn for sweaters.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca  tiene 45 años es casada tiene dos  hijos que tienen la edad de 17 y 21 años, ella se dedica a la confección de sabana y edredones, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Francisca  utilizara este préstamo para compra te telas por rollo para la confección de sus edredones y sabanas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Francisca enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Señora Francisca is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, who are 17 and 21 years old. She makes sheets and comforters. She has been working in this business for a number of years. Her workshop is located in the Villa Fátima zone. This is her first loan with this institution. Señora Francisca will use this loan to buy fabrics by the roll to make her comforters and sheets. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of working capital. Señora Francisca faces challenges in her business, which are to continue improving the quality of the construction of her products. She is going to use the earnings to continue increasing her working capital.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sheets and comforters

loans.name: Lufo

texts.en: Lufo is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Lufo needs a loan to get all the equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Lufo will use the profits from her sales to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, shovels, fertilizer, and a bush knife.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and lives in the town of Buwama, Uganda. She has two biological children and two other children who are under her care. In total, she has four children: two girls and two boys.

Florence plays many roles in her community. She runs a study center in the town of Buwama that teaches people basics in computing and typing services, and she is also a Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar-powered lanterns and phone charging to their communities. With this Kiva loan, Florence will purchase more solar inventory that she will then resell to her community.

Florence loves being a Solar Sister because it helps her earn additional income. She uses the income she earns as a Solar Sister to supplement her children's school fees. The money also helps her to buy household items for the house like sugar, salt, etc.

Florence's biggest motivation in selling solar lanterns is seeing her community empowered. She has seen many accidents in her neighborhood that have been caused as a result of kerosene lanterns. 

Her biggest dream is to build her own home and also start an entertainment business, using one of the bigger solar-powered kits that powers a 21-inch TV and radio.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two of whom currently attend school. She is not looking after any other member of the family.

She has been operating an eating place for three years and works five days a week. She also sells blocks for building as another source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy rice, flour, beef, ground nuts, cooking oil, green bananas and charcoal. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business. She rents a house without access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rice, flour, beef, ground nuts, cooking oil, green bananas and charcoal

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
This is Rosejean, 36, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Zacarias, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosejean owns and oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosejean dreams to give her children a good and quality education and hopes to be successful in her business through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and is married with four children. He sells rice. He has four years of experience with this business, and he works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day of the week except Sunday.

Joseph has requested a loan via Vision Finance Company, Kiva's field partner, in order to purchase a huge quantity of rice for resale. With any profits, Joseph plans to reinvest in his business, save for his future and buy medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantities of rice for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old. She is married with six children.

Mary is a full-time Solar Sister. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar energy products to their communities. As a Solar Sister, Mary has learned marketing and business skills. 

Mary uses the money she earns to support her family and to pay school fees.

Mary’s dream is to save up and own a shop, where she can sell more things and also make more people aware of solar technology and how they can be empowered by it.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community.

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en: Odsuren, 34, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a transport business using his own automobile. His wife works as a cook in restaurant, and his daughters go to high school. Soon, his beloved younger brother is getting married, and he wants to present a home to the new couple. However, due to financial problems, he can’t afford to purchase the home himself, so he is requesting a loan of 1000000 MNT. It is a well-insulated traditional home that will reduce the family's coal consumption, which will have a positive impact on the environment.

loans.use: to buy a home.

loans.name: Moelosa

texts.en:
Moelosa is 35 years old and married with five children. For the past year, she has been making and selling tapa (cloth made from bark) clothing and printed material to earn a living. Moelosa joined SPBD in 2010 to access financial services.

Moelosa is requesting a loan to buy paint, a design board, brushes, and rubber bands. She plans to use the profit from her loan to support her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy paint, a design board, brushes, and rubber bands

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela is 48 years old and married with two children. For many years, she has owned and operated a small store where she sells items such as soap, snacks, washing powder, and other products. Sela became a member of SPBD in 2008 to access business capital. 

Sela is requesting a loan to buy soap, washing powders, sugar, salt, snacks, and other products. She hopes to use her profits to help with the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy soap, washing powders, sugar, salt, snacks, and other products

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with three children, one of whom currently attends school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and does not look after additional family members. For the past three years, Justine has been running a restaurant from her home. She works seven days a week and has no other source of income. Justine's challenges include transportation and seasonality. She lives in a rented house without access to electricity or running water and her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

Justine is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy rice, beef, chicken, beans, cow peas, green bananas, and charcoal. In the future, her dream is to expand her business into a big restaurant that serves all types of dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, beef, chicken, beans, cow peas, green bananas, and charcoal

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
