Bang was born in 1967. She has three children who are carpenters. Her husband is a constructor. She is a farmer. She raises chickens and gets about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 4,256,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,048,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She wants to use the profit to enlarge her farm of chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Busaira

texts.ru: Бусайра 33 года, замужем. У них с мужем три замечательных дочери. Все дети школьного возраста 12 лет, 8 лет и 3 годика.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Бусайра начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с 5,000 сом (KGS) 11 лет назад, хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. Благодаря упорному труду Бусайра, ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 голов бычков. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бусайра обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 молодых бычков по более низкой цене. Доходы Бусайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса за счет увеличения поголовья скота. В её планах в будущем построить теплые помещения для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Busaira is 33 years old, and married. She and her husband have three wonderful daughters. All children are in school age: 12, 8 and 3 years old. 

In search of a main income for the family, Busaira started working with livestock breeding. Having started 11 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS), the business currently brings in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products and the resale of livestock. Thanks to Busaira's persistent work, the farm counts two bulls. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Busaira turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two young bulls at a very low price. Busaira plans to invest the income in further developing her business through increasing the number of livestock. She plans to build a warm room for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
25-year-old Robert lives in Yerevan town with his parents, grandparents and sister. Robert is currently in his 1st year of studies at the University of Traditional Medicine, where he is taking his master's degree in the field of general medicine. In addition to his studies, Robert works at a local school as a keeper. 

Robert's parents work hard to secure the family's livelihood. But it is very difficult for them to save money for their son's education. Which is why Robert requested this loan to pay for his university tuition. Robert is a very hard-working and intelligent young man with a lot of goals for the future. With the help of the loan Robert will be able to continue his education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Bubusara

texts.ru: Бубусара 55 лет, вдова, с ней вместе живут сын и дочь.Дочь школьница, а сын активно помогает маме по хозяйству. Бубусара имеет среднее специальное образование, после окончания лицея сразу вышла замуж. По характеру очень хороший человек. Имеет хорошие отзывы от соседей. Они её любят и поддерживают. Бубусара в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1995 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубусара в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы и 5 голов овец, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов и дополнительно от полеводства. Клиентка обрабатывает 1,2 га земли где ежегодно сеет ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубусара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы, 5 овец и 1 теленка. Доходы от кредита Бубусара планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота. Забота о детях и обеспечение хорошего образования для них, это приоритетная задача для Бубусара.
texts.en:
Bubusara is 55 years old, and a widow. Her son and her daughter live together with her. The daughter goes to school while the son actively helps his mother with her business. Bubusara has a specialized secondary education, and after having finished this she immediately married. She is a very good person by nature, and her neighbors speak well of her. They love her and support her. 

In search of a main income for the family, Bubusara started working with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding in 1995. She started this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent work, her farm today has three cows and five sheep. The monthly income from the business is around 12,000 som (KGS), from the sale milk and dairy products and in addition from crop cultivation. Bubusara processes 1.2 hectares of land where she sows barley every year. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Bubusara turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of one cow, five sheep and one calf. Bubusara plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business through purchasing additional livestock. The care for her children and providing a good education for them is the main priority for Bubusara.

loans.use: to purchase one cow, five sheep and one calf

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife, the mother of his four children who are all attending school. Like every couple, Ibrahim and his wife wish to offer their children a respectable life, far from problems and difficulties. For this reason, they combine forces to be able to afford the heavy life expenses. 

Ibrahim opened his own butchery in 2002. He’s a reputable person who always searches to offer his customers good and fresh products. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added cattle for his business and increase his sales. In that way, he will be capable to develop his business and augment his earnings. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and enlarge his business as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy added cattle for his business and increase his sales

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny, aged 30, lives in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district. She has three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She is a rice farmer in the area to make a living and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. Ny and her husband have been in this business for 17 years. The current business earns her about US$7 per day and allows her to save about US$3 each day after daily expenses.

This is a micro loan for Ny with Kiva’s partner. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy material for building a latrine, such as a toilet bowl, tile drainage etc. Ny hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy material for building a latrine.

loans.name: Los Cumplidos Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS CUMPLIDOS está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales cinco  son mujeres y tres varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Aurora tiene 35 años, casada y tiene 6 hijos que son de las edades de 14, 12, gemelos de 11, 9 Y 5 años,  se dedica a la venta de comida  en la localidad de Zanja de Honda,  Este préstamo es el Segundo secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra.  Aurora va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como arroz, fideo, papa y aceite por mayor Su razón para solicitar este préstamo por la falta de capital, Aurora enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que los  precios han subido y muchas veces los insumos  escasean y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Aurora es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en:
Communal Bank LOS CUMPLIDOS is composed of eight members: five women and three men. They all have different lines of work.

Mrs. Aurora, 35, is the group’s president. She is married and has six children who are 14, 12, 11 (twins), 9 and 5 years old. She sells food in a town called Zanja de Honda. This is her second loan with this institution. Aurora will use this loan to invest in supplies for preparing food, such as rice, noodles, potato and oil in bulk. She is requesting this loan because she lacks the capital. Aurora faces the challenges of rising prices and shortages. She will use the loan to buy supplies for making food.

Mrs. Aurora is a hardworking person. She feels happy and appreciates all the support given by the institution.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make more cakes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Faapisa

texts.en:
Faapisa is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells rice and curry in Saint Theresa Pri School and in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Faapisa  needs a loan to purchase more bags of rice, chicken leg quarters and etc. 

She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. Faapisa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, chicken legs, flour, curry, onions and salt.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 28 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as food and drinks in her community. She has been doing this for two years. 

Telesia needs a loan to purchase more foods, cigarettes and drinks. She hopes to use her profits to save for business needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, salts and onions.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est une jeune femme de 48 ans mariée , mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 et 25 ans. Tous vont déjà au collège. elle a ouvert et gère une boutique de vente emportée de boissons depuis 1 ans. son activité fonctionne mais elle manque souvent de stock parce qu'elle achète en petite quantité parce que son capital ne lui permet pas de faire autrement. Elle est obligée à chaque fois de faire écouler tout son stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer un nouveau. D'où son besoin de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter des casiers de boisson . Le bénéfice lui permettra d'agrandir sa structure. Elle économisera le reste pour la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: Marguerite is a young 48 year old woman who is married and the mother of 4 children whose ages range from 9 to 25 years old. All go to school already. She opened and has been managing a shop selling imported drinks for 1 year. Her business functions but she often lacks stock because she buys in small quantities because her capital doesn't allow her to do otherwise. She is obliged each time to sell all her stock to be able to get another. Thus her need for this loan which will allow her to increase her cases of drinks. The profits will allow her to expand her structure. She will save the rest for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cases of drinks.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha comes from the district of Kwale. She is married and has two young children. She started her business selling basic consumer goods in her kiosk. She currently has a small grocery store which allows her to have a small income to help her husband with the household expenses.

Asha is asking for this loan in order to buy sugar, rice, oil, sodas, flour and other products to stock her grocery store. With the loan, she is hoping to offer more products to her customers and improve her business. Her goal is to offer more products so she can satisfy the needs of her customers, as well as have a better income that will allow her to have a stable and profitable business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, sodas, flour and other products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Williams, de 47 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy trabajador, está casado y tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad quien es su motivo de inspiración ya que su máximo deseo es que logre ser un profesional. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo de Williams consiste en brindar el servicio de mecánico dando solución a diferentes problemas técnicos o eléctricos en el funcionamiento de vehículos menores como motos y mototaxis. Tiene un amplio local de atención en un espacio de su casa en donde también ha destinado un área de orientación y seguridad vehicular otorgando los principales requisitos que necesita el vehículo de algún ciudadano como SOAT, alarmas de seguridad, identificación personalizada entre otros. Lleva en este negocio más de 10 años y trabaja solo. Actualmente también vende repuestos vehiculares como complemento dentro de su asociación de mototaxistas. Eventualmente trabaja conduciendo su propio mototaxi para generar ingresos económicos adicionales para su familia. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que tiene la oportunidad de recibir diversos contratos a diario y en diferentes rubros, por ello puede trabajar ya sea como mecánico, como transportista o en algunas ocasiones también como electricista, tiene muchos planes en cuanto a su actividad pero por el momento solo está avocado a consolidar su asociación de mototaxistas y brindar un mejor servicio que sea reconocido en el sector de transportistas..
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, complementará su taller con algunas herramientas que usa en su trabajo de mecánico comprando ciertos repuestos como llantas, eje, válvula, discos y carburadores.
texts.en:
Williams is 47 years old. He is a good, friendly and hard-working man. He is married and has a 19 year-old son who is motivation. His dream is for him to become a professional. They live together in their own house. 

Williams' work consists of offering his service as a mechanic, resolving different technical or electrical problems in minor vehicles such as motorcycles and motor-taxis. He has a large service area in his home where he also has an area designated for orientation and vehicle safety. He sells the principal requirements needed by any citizen with a vehicle, such as SOAT [Obligatory Insurance for Transit Accidents], security alarms, and personalized identification among other things. 

He has been in this business for more than 10 years and he works alone. Occasionally, he works driving his own motor-taxi to generate additional income for his family. The good thing about his work is that he has the opportunity to receive different contracts every day, in different fields. This way he can work as a mechanic or taxi driver, or in some cases, also as an electrician. 

He has many plans regarding his business, but for the moment he is just concerned with strengthening his membership in the association of motor-taxi drivers, and to offer the best possible service in the transportation sector. With the requested 2000 soles, he will provide his workshop with some tools that he uses in his work as a mechanic, buying certain replacement parts like tires, axles, exhaust valves, discs and carburetors.

loans.use: to buy tires, axles, an exhaust valve, discs and carburetors.

loans.name: Trabajando En Grupo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia Edith, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos que aún están bajo su cargo. Ellos son su mayor motivación para salir adelante y por los que se ve en la necesidad de trabajar para poder cubrir sus gastos de estudios.
La Sra. Silvia Edith, forma parte del grupo "Trabajando en Grupo", que se ha formado recientemente con 7 personas mas, todos ellos con la misma meta, salir adelante mediante el trabajo y apoyo conjunto.
Ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catalogos, ofrece a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, y aprovecha sobre todo en comprar productos que esten en oferta para su stock.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para su venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Edith is 47 years old, and married with 4 children who are still under her care.  They are her biggest motivation for getting ahead, and paying for their education is the reason she must work.  Mrs. Silvia Edith is part of the group, "Trabajando en Grupo", which was recently formed with 7 other people, all of whom have the same goal of improving their lives through work and each other's support. 

For the past 10 years she has been working in the sale of beauty products through catalogs.  She sells them to friends, neighbors and family members, and she takes advantage of discounted prices when purchasing her inventory.  She will use this loan to purchase perfumes, creams and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of beauty products that are currently at reduced prices because it is the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: La Sra. Anita sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de carmes y quesos en su frial que se encuentra en la localidad de  Paurito, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de queso y carne por mayor para ofrecer los productos a su clienela.
texts.en: Anita continues selling meats and cheeses at a market in Paurito.  She says that things went well for her with the previous loan and is asking for a loan now to buy cheese and meat in quantity to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat and cheese.

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime is a 49-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, a plantation. She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. 

Menime will use the loan to buy timber, roofing iron, cement and nails. Menime  joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy timber, roofing, nails and tiles.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 38 years old. She is a widow with three children who has earned a living for the past seven years by selling various food items. She earns enough money to provide food for her family, and is requesting a loan to increase her profits by buying more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income she earns to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en: Ms Yasmin is 33 years old and the mother of four children. For the last 15 years, she has earned a living by selling milk. She began her business by buying a buffalo whose milk she could sell to help support her family and supplement her husband's income. With the passage of time, her sales have increased as has her income. She now has two buffaloes and a lot of clients because she provides good service. Because of her work, she is respected in her home and helps helps her husband in all family as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan for PKR 25,000 to buy another buffalo to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business, and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
Las señora Maria Ofelia esta soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, no esta estudiando solo cuso los 2 años de educacion primaria, se dedica al tricotado de hilos en sus diferentes diseños y colores, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a al comercio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y tinte para teñido, espera mejorar su producción de tricotado, espera en el futuro tener el negocio de tejidos de cortes típicos y con trabajadores, y así mejorar su ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Ofelia is a single, 23-year-old woman who is not studying and only completed 2 years of primary education. She makes a living knitting in different designs and colors. She started this business thanks to the support of her parents and, as of now, she has 3 years of experience. She also counts on the support of her husband, who works as a salesman. 

Maria Ofelia is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase dye and threads in different colors. She expects to improve her knitting production and to increase her income by setting up a business in the future weaving traditional textiles with workers.

loans.use: to purchase threads for weaving textiles.

loans.name: Uluolegogosina

texts.en:
Uluolegogosina is 52 years old and married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Uluolegogosina needs a loan to purchase veggie seeds, chemicals, and farming tools to start a new business. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Uluolegogosina will use the profits from her sales to save in her account for family needs.

loans.use: veggie seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Charen

texts.en:
Charen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

NWTF is relisting Charen's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Marcela Lizbeth

texts.es: La Sra. Marcela  tiene 19 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa y cinturones ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Marcela va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  ropa como chompas y variedad de cinturones  por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio y también que se acerca la época de de fin de año y esta época es de mucha demanda, la Sra. Marcela va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa por mayor.
texts.en: Marcela is 19 years old.  She sells a variety of clothing and belts.  She has a permanent stand in one of Santa Cruz’s busiest markets where she sells her products.  This is her first loan with the institution.  Marcela is going to use the loan to purchase a variety of clothing such as sweaters and a variety of belts wholesale.  This will enable her to offer a variety of clothing to her customers and increase her profits.  The reason she is requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Also, the end of the year season is approaching and this is a time of high demand.  Marcela is going to use the profits to continue purchasing a variety of wholesale clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of wholesale clothing and belts.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: la Sra. Juana sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de empanadas y refrescos en su puetso de venta que s eencuentra en la zona de las Vegas, cuenbta que le fue bien con el anterior credito, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como azucar al por mayor para la elaboracion de sus refrescos ya que esta espoca de calor tiene mucha demanda de este producto.
texts.en: Señora Juana still sells empanadas and soft drinks on her stall in the Las Vegas area. She says that her previous loan went very well. This time, she is requesting a loan to buy wholesale ingredients such as sugar to make soft drinks, because it is the warm season and the demand for this product is high.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sugar to make soft drinks.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton, de 21 años de edad, es un joven trabajador y empeñoso, así como también es alegre y amable, es conviviente con Xiomi, quien trabaja como cajera en una tienda. Vive en compañía de su abuelita, su mamá y su pareja, habitando la casa de su abuelita. El negocio de Milton es la venta de comidas, actividad que lo realiza en el frontis de la casa de su abuelita, para eso cuenta con una mesa y utensilios necesarios para atender muy bien a sus clientes. Pues la ventaja que tiene, es que es muy transitada la zona donde vive. Le gusta su trabajo, ya que le agrada cocinar, pues aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó los secretos de una buena sazón, con eso espera poder ganarse la preferencia y aceptación de sus clientes. Además tiene planes de crecer y en un futuro abrir un restaurante en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad de Pucallpa, logrando así obtener mayores ingresos. Por tanto éste será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas para comenzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Milton, 21 years old, is a young, dedicated worker who is also cheerful and friendly.  He lives with his girlfriend, Xiomi, who works as a cashier in a store.  They live with his grandmother, his mother and her partner, in his grandmother's home.  Milton's business is selling food, a job which he does in front of his grandmother's house.  He has a table and the necessary utensils to serve his clients well.  The advantage that he has is that the area he lives in is very well travelled.  He enjoys his work, and cooking makes him happy.  He learned to cook from his mother who taught him the secrets of a good seasoning, with which he hopes to gain the preference and acceptance of his customers.  He also has plans to grow and in the future open a restaurant in a commercial area of the city of Pucallpa, which would allow him to increase his revenue.  

This will be his first loan with the MFP Institution, and he hopes that the collaboration will help him to achieve his goals.  He will invest the requested loan of 500 nuevos soles in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of food for his business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Martha Águeda

texts.es:
La señora Martha Águeda tiene un negocio de ventas de refresco naturales, desde hace once años se levanta muy de mañanita para ir al mercado a comprar frutas frescas para la elaboración de sus deliciosos refrescos naturales para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de León. 

El  crédito solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar por mayor su producto para la elaboración  de sus refrescos tales como: azúcar, cacao, semilla, canela, cebada linaza, frutas variadas, bolsas plásticas y pajillas, para así obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y su familia. 

Doña Martha sueña con terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha Águeda has had a natural soft drink business for eleven years.  She gets up very early to go to the market to buy fresh fruit to make her delicious drinks to satisfy her customer demand in one of the Leon markets.

She will use the money from this loan, through CEPRODEL, to buy supplies and ingredients such as sugar, cacao, seeds, cinnamon, barley, flaxseed, fruits, plastic bags, and straws to increase her income and improve her family’s quality of life.

Martha dreams of finishing her house.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Estimados señores de KIVA, doña maria es comerciante de ropa usada, un negocio que ha tenido una gran aceptación en Nicaragua por los bajos costos de adquirir ropa de adulto y para niños.
Ella necesita un préstamo para mejorar su actividad comercial, su plan de inversión es para comprar una paca de ropa usada para niños, y contribuir a satisfacer la necesidad de compra de sus clientes.
Doña maria se dedicaba antes a vender mariscos de forma ambulante de casa en casa, pero gracias a sus ahorros que obtuvo de este negocio decide poner su negocio de ropa usada en su casa de habitación.
Su estado civil es casada y tiene tres hijos a su cargo.
Es una persona de principios y valores cristianos.
texts.en:
Dear people of KIVA, Maria is a used clothing merchant, a business which has become very popular in Nicaragua thanks to the low cost of buying clothing for adults and children.
 
She needs a loan to improve her business activity. Her investment plan is to buy a pack of used clothing for children. This will help satisfy her customers' purchasing needs. 

Earlier, Maria worked selling seafood as a mobile vendor, going from house to house, but thanks to the savings she obtained from that business, she decided to set up her used clothing business, which she operates out of her home. 

She is married and has three children in her care. 

She is a person with principles and Christian values.

loans.use: to invest in buying a pack of clothing from the USA.

loans.name: Octavienne

texts.en: Octavienne is 43 years old, married to a civil servant and the mother of six children who range in age from one to 22 years old. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by selling various food items. This business has allowed her to provide for the basic needs of her family. Octavienne is requesting a loan to buy more beans, peanuts and cooking oil to sell to her customers so that she can earn more profits. She will use these profits to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, peanuts and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Parraxaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria esta casada, tiene 35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 están estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales, específicamente de pollos de engorde, inicio este negocio cuando se caso, por la necesidad de contar con otros ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, hasta ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a las actividades de jornalero. 

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizará para la compra de pollos de engorde, espera en el futuro tener una granja grande de pollos de engorde. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales y al comercio.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is married, 35 years old, and didn't have the chance to study. She has eight children, four of whom are studying. 

She makes a living raising animals, in particular broiler chickens. She set up this business when she got married, because she needed another income to help her husband with household expenses. Today, she has ten years of experience, and is supported by her husband who works as a day labourer. 

Maria is organising a group to request a loan, which she will use to buy broiler chickens.  In the future, she hopes to own a large broiler chicken farm. The other members of the group make a living raising animals and doing business.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to use to grow maize and sorghum.

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es:
Doña maria se dedica a producir tortillas suaves y tostadas, este es un producto elaborado a base de maíz, y muy popular en la comida de los nicaragüenses.

Este oficio lo aprendió de su madre cuando ella tenía apenas catorce años de edad y desde entonces nace la idea de hacerlo como su medio de trabajo.

Ella es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo y en edad escolar, y con los ingresos que obtiene vendiendo tortillas lleva el sustento diario a su hogar y para solventar los gastos de educación y de salud.
Necesita una fuente de financiamiento para adquirir maíz por quintales y leña, esto con el objetivo de disminuir los costos de producir la tortilla.

Es una persona esforzada y dedicada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria makes a living selling corn tortillas (both soft and toasted), which are a very popular Nicaraguan food. Her mother taught her how to make these when she was 14 years old. Since then, she has had the idea of making a business out of producing these tortillas. Maria is a single mother of two school-aged children. With her earnings from this tortilla business, she provides for her family's household, educational, and medical expenses. She is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her children.

Maria needs this loan in order to buy corn in bulk as well as firewood. This will help her to reduce the cost of producing her tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita earns a living by selling food to people in Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been in this business for several years and is requesting a loan to buy more of the ingredients, such as flour, sugar and oil, she needs to make her food items. In the future, Julita hopes to expand her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food items to sell.

loans.name: Buba

texts.en:
Buba is separated with six children, three of whom are under the age of 15 years. She lives in a five-room apartment house with her family in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. 

She encountered some challenges in her life, like the sickness of her child for many years and the death of her mother and her other relatives. 

With the loan, she plans to buy bags of fresh corn, bags of garri (a popular West African food made from cassava tubers), fish, tomatoes, Maggi, and salt for cooking. Also, she plans to buy a new variety of seedlings of maize, beans, and yams and also to buy a bag of fertilizer. She believes this activity will succeed because of her longevity in the business. Her business site is located in a strategic place where many people pass by. The high demand for her commodities in the community is a reason for the success of the activity. The community benefits in that many people prefer to buy directly from the farm at cheaper prices rather than go to the market. With the fresh corn from her farm, she will sell some and roast some.  

With the profits, she plans to expand her business and improve the living standard of her family by providing them with better education and health care. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to purchase fresh maize for roasting, maize, beans, seedlings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Rosa, tiene 63 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella forma parte del grupo "Mujeres Unidas por Siempre", que está formado por seis socias, solo mujeres trabajadoras y responsables caracteristicas que fueron necesarias verificar para que puedan formar su grupo.
La Sra. Carmen Rosa se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de menu, trabajo que le ha servido para poder solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia. Inició su negocio en la puerta de su domicilio, atendiendo a muy pocos clientes, poco a poco la gente iva conociendo y probando su sazon y fue así que creció su clientela.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos pero en mayor cantidad para que el precio le salga mas bajo como sacos de arroz, sacos de azucar, aceite, todo los prodcutos que no se descompongan y pueda mantenerlo guardado.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen Rosa is 63 years old, single, and has no children. She is part of the "Mujeres Unidas por Siempre" (Women United Forever) group, which has six members. They are all hard-working and responsible women, characteristics which were necessary to check to create the group. 

Señora Carmen Rosa has worked for the past ten years selling food. This work has helped her to cover personal expenses and support her family. She began her business in the doorway of her home, serving few customers. Little by little, people heard about the business and tried her food, and this is how her customer base grew. 

She will invest the loan to buy larger quantities of supplies so that it costs her less.  She will buy bags of rice and sugar, oil, and any products that do not go off and she can store.

loans.use: to invest in supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Ana Marcela

texts.es:
Estimados Señores de KIVA, marcela es una joven emprendedora que tiene 20 años de edad, su actividad comercial es vender cosméticos de la marca avon por encargos y de forma ambulante.
Su idea de negocio nace por iniciativa propia y por el apoyo económico de sus padres, actualmente es estudiante universitaria de la carrera farmacia, y con los ingresos que obtiene de las ventas de cosméticos se ayuda para los gastos universitarios.
Sin embargo la demanda de sus productos ha crecido, y necesita el apoyo económico para comprar un pedido de cosméticos y de esta forma dar respuesta a la demanda de sus clientes y elevar sus niveles de venta.
Su estado civil es soltero, vive aun con sus padres.
Tiene espíritu de superación personal y con deseos de salir adelante como muchos jóvenes en Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Dear KIVA lenders, 
Marcela is a young entrepreneur.  She is 20 years old, and her business is selling Avon cosmetics.  She takes orders and also sells door to door. 
Marcela took her own initiative in starting her business and had the financial support of her parents in doing so.  She is currently a university student studying for a pharmacy career.  The money she earns selling cosmetics helps with her schooling expenses.
Nevertheless, demand for her products has grown, and she needs financial support in order to pay for a cosmetics order.  In doing so, she will be able to respond to her customers' demand and elevate her sales level.  
Marcela is single and still lives with her parents. 
Marcela has a spirit of personal improvement and a desire to get ahead, just like many young people in Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of Avon products.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Doña maria es originaria de san Rafael del sur, una ciudad de Nicaragua ubicada frente a las playas del pacífico nicaragüense, su negocio es vender artesanía y bisutería a los turistas nacionales e internacionales que visitan las hermosas playas de Nicaragua.
Sus productos son pulseras, collares, chapas, adornos variados, entre otros.
Necesita una fuente de financiamiento para diversificar su negocio y ofrecer productos que demandan su segmento de mercado.
Antes se dedicaba a vender tortillas, sin embargo logra descubrir que comercializar artesanía es un negocio que podía desarrollar muy bien, y poder ser un agente económico para su familia.
Su estado civil es acompañada, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales todos van a la escuela.
texts.en:
Maria is originally from San Rafael del Sur, a city in Nicaragua, located along the beaches of the Nicaraguan Pacific coastline.  She sells, arts and crafts and costume jewelry to local and international tourists who visit the beautiful beaches of Nicaragua.  She sells bracelets, necklaces, pins, and various accessories.

She needs this loan to diversify her business and offer products that others want.  She used to sell tortillas, however she realized that she could develop this business better and help her family financially.

She’s married and has three children who all attend school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, a 26-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom is in school, works very hard to provide for them. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for eight years, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, soap, sugar and other groceries.

Gina has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Brenda Matilde

texts.es:
Doña Brenda es comerciante de mariscos, tiene cinco años de tener su negocio donde ha adquirido experiencia en su actividad comercial, su forma de venta es ambulante de casa en casa en algunos barrios de Managua.
Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado establecer buenas relaciones con sus clientes, por lo que le están demandando variedad de mariscos y necesita mayor capital de trabajo para atender los encargos de sus clientes.
Ella se dedicaba solamente a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero para contribuir y apoyar económicamente  a los gastos del hogar y brindarles una mejor seguridad alimenticia a sus hijos, decidieron dedicarse a este negocio para obtener otros ingresos.
Su estado civil es casada y tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, dos en secundaria, y una en primaria.
texts.en: Brenda is a seafood trader.  During the five years that she has had her business, she has gained experience in her trade.  She sells her products door-to-door in various neighborhoods in Managua.  Thanks to her efforts, she has established good relationships with her customers, who are demanding a variety of seafood.  She needs more working capital to meet customer orders. Brenda was dedicated solely to household chores, but in order to provide financial support and contribute to the household expenses and provide better food security to their children, they decided to establish this business to earn extra income.  She is married and has four children in her care, two in secondary school and one in primary.

loans.use: to purchase seafood, such as fish and shrimp, and pork.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 63-year-old dairy farmer. He is married to Juliana who is a farmer. Their children are now all adults. Robert has been in the farming business for the past 20 years, with a monthly income of KES. 16,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Robert is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after having repaid his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy animal feeds. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy another dairy cow. His hope is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en:
Thiet was born in 1973. She has three children. The oldest child is a student. The younger child is learning in the 10th grade. The youngest one is learning in the 3rd grade. She and her husband sell rice to earn a living. She gains 3,000,000 VND a month from it. Her family's total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more rice to sell. She always wants to raise her children to grow well and get good jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old. She is married to a truck helper; they have three children aged between 6 and 14 years old. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for one year. Mary needs a loan in order to buy more charcoal for sale to make more profits. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en:
Ms. Kishwer is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been successfully selling vegetables and fruits for the last seven years. By this time she has become famous in providing fresh vegetables in her community. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a government school as a peon and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.
 
She is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy sacks of fresh vegetables such as potatoes, onions, etc. from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fresh vegetables such as potatoes, onions, etc. from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
Isabel Berenise tiene 23 años de edad. Ella es socia del grupo "Los Claveles". este grupo está formado por siete integrantes, todos ellos vecinos y se unieron para que juntos tengan la facilidad de obtener un crédito que los ayude a sostener su negocio ya que de forma individual les era dificil porque no tenían como avalarse individualmente.
Hace un año, Isabel Berenise, trabaja de forma independiente, vendiendo salchipapas, inició con muy poco utensilios y preparando en la cocina de su casa, con su trabajo poco a poco a podido implementar su negocio con un carrito sanguchero, cubiertos, vasos etc.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de tapers, platos y cubiertos descartables, que es lo necesario para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Isabel Berenise is 23 years old. She is a member of the "Los Claveles" group. This group has seven members, who are all neighbours and who came together to make it easier to get a loan to help them sustain their business.  That's because it was harder for them individually, since they didn't have anyone to support them.

One year ago, Isabel Berenise, who works alone selling "salchipapas"- french fries with hotdogs, began with few utensils and cooked food in the kitchen of her home. Little by little, with her work, she has been able to buy a mobile food cart, eating utensils, glasses, etc. for her business.

She will use the loan to invest in disposable plates, eating utensils, and tupperware, which she needs for her work.

loans.use: to invest in supplies and disposable items to to serve the food they prepare.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina, tiene un negocio de ventas de refresco naturales y producto de primera necesidad, en uno de los  mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace trece años, inicia a preparar sus deliciosos  refrescos a las 6:00 en su casa posteriormente se traslada a su puesto de venta para su comercialización finalizando a las 1:00 pm. Es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales ninguno está a su cargo. 

El  crédito que esta solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar por mayor el producto para la elaboración de sus refresco tale como: azúcar, cacao, semilla, canela, cebada linaza, frutas variadas, sopa maggi, pasta alimenticia, salsa de tomate, y así obtener mayores ingresos, los que le permitirán realizar  su sueños como es la mejora de  su vivienda  y así  brindarle una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalina has a business selling natural beverages and staple food products in one of the markets of the city of León. She has operated this business for thirteen years. She starts preparing her delicious beverages at 6:00 in her home. Later, she travels to her sales stand where she sells her products, finishing up at 1:00 pm. She is the mother of four children, none of whom is still in her care. 

The loan she is requesting from Ceprodel will be used to buy products on a wholesale basis to prepare her beverages, such as sugar, cacao, seeds, barley, linseed, and various fruits, as well as Maggi soup mixes, noodles and tomato sauce. In this way, she will obtain a better income, which will allow her to achieve her dreams such as improving her home and thus providing better comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cacao, seeds, cinnamon, barley, linseed, various fruits, Maggi soup mixes, noodles, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 35 years old and married with four children, her spouse runs a farming business which helps in producing some additional income. Alice runs a general retail shop and she has been in business for four years. Her monthly income from the business is KES. 6,000.
 

She has borrowed her second loan of KES. 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her business like dry maize, beans and green grams for sale.


She plans to use the additional income to plough back into the business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy dry maize, beans and green grams (lentils) for sale.

loans.name: Teckla

texts.en:
Teckla is 20 years old, married, and she supports a family of three. She runs a grocery shop and this has been her income-generating business for the last four years where she gets an average monthly income of KES. 30,000. 


She has borrowed a second loan of KES 20,000 after successfully repaying her previous loan. With this loan she intends to purchase more stock of assorted cereals, e.g. rice, beans, and green grams (lentils) for her grocery shop. She anticipates making a profit which she will use to expand her business to feature more items to meet her client demand.


Teckla hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted cereals, e.g., rice, beans, and green grams (lentils)

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married with five children. Evangeline is 43 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City.

To earn a living, Evangeline has a house service business. She has had this business for 10 years. Each day, she earns approximately 200 PHP (Philippines pesos). Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for two years.

In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to finance for the house repair

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy used his previous loan of 100,000 KES to buy bananas, vegetables, and sugarcane for his grocery business.  He earned more income with the additional stock. He also used the additional income to boost his farming business, growing tea and raising cattle.

Kennedy hopes to improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested a loan of 105,300 KES to buy green bananas, millet, potatoes, and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To buy green bananas, millet, potatoes, and vegetables

loans.name: Dorinda

texts.en:
Dorinda is 71 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.  Dorinda sells a variety of products to earn a living and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 9,000 to purchase more raw ingredients to make snacks to sell.
Dorinda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Dorinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the  repair and maintenance of the karaoke machine and of the place for better service offered.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She owns a mobile phone money transfer business. She also runs a school. She is very aggressive and hardworking. Faulu Kenya has helped her to understand the importance of saving. Beatrice hopes to someday own a piece of land to build her school instead of renting the premises. She requires a loan of 74,013 KES to buy textbooks.

loans.use: to buy textbooks

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 32 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He earns a living by selling tomato sauce and he has been in business for four years.  He is very hard working and, since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money and also increase his profits. 

He wishes to expand his business and own a wholesale shop. He is requesting a loan of 42,727 KES in order to open a another retail business outlet, and the loan will help him buy storage containers and other ingredients of making tomato sauce to put in the outlet.

loans.use: to open another business outlet, buy storage containers and other ingredients of making tomato sauce

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.
 
Teresita has a shop that sells groceries goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy groceries goods for her grocery store business.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve to her living conditions by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy groceries goods for her grocery store business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul (on the picture shaving hair of a customer) is a 29 year old married man. He has 2 children aged 2 and 5. He describes himself as hard-working. He operates a barber shop where he provides haircutting services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy and viable area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. Paul will use his KES 10,000 loan to buy barber shop tools. His business goal is to boost his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will buy land for his family.

loans.use: to buy buy barber shop tools

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old and is married with three children. She takes care of five relatives. She owns a sewing business and she currently employs one person to help her. She has 12 years of experience in this business. 

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more materials for her sewing to get more profits. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future, and to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her sewing

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Cornelio, de 65 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Lidia, con quien tuvo 10 hijos a los que cuidó y educó. Ahora solo vive en compañía de su esposa en la casa que compró hace 12 años. 
Su vida se centró en el trabajo duro, pues desde que cumplió los 17 años tuvo que lidiar con la responsabilidad de ser padre, por lo que comenzó a sembrar y producir sus propios ingresos con la agricultura sus sembríos constan de habas, maíz, trigo y papa, que comercializa en la ciudad de Jauja, los fines de semana. Posee terrenos propios productivos, los cuales cuida en compañía de su esposa y eventualmente con la ayuda de algunos de sus hijos a quienes recurre cuando las fuerzas se terminas. Ahora espera poder mejorar sus sembríos y cuidarse para seguir sembrando, ya que es lo que disfruta tanto.  Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Cornelio, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues se encuentra en temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Cornelio, 65, is a responsible man.  He lives with his wife, Lidia, with whom he raised and educated 10 children.  Now he lives only with his wife in the home he bought 12 years ago.

His life centers on hard work because he had to contend with the responsibility of being a father since he turned 17.  This is why he began to plant crops and produce his own income by growing beans, corn, wheat, and potatoes, which he sells in the city of Jauja on the weekend.  He has productive land of his own, which he takes care of with his wife and, possibly, with with the help of some of his children, to whom he turns when he has no more energy.  Now he hopes to improve his crops and take care of himself so he can continue planting, because this is what he enjoys so much.

This is his third loan with MFP.  He's grateful for the economic support it offers him because this way he'll continue with the improvement projects for his business.  He also promises to be punctual with his payments.

Cornelio will invest the money in buying organic fertilizer for his plantings because he's in the planting season.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña juana tiene veintidós años de edad, su negocio es vender zapatos de caballeros y para damas por encargos.
Su negocio es pequeño y lo inicia con el apoyo económico de su esposo.
Ha descubierto que sus productos tienen una gran aceptación en su comunidad, por ser un producto de calidad y un precio accesible.
Para poder atender los pedidos de sus clientes necesita una fuente de financiamiento para comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos y dar respuesta a los encargos de sus clientes.
Su estado civil es casado, y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad.
texts.en:
Juana is twenty-two years old. She has a business selling men's shoes and women's sandals to order. Her business is small and she started it with financial help from her husband. 

She has discovered that there is great demand for her products in her community, because they are high-quality and affordable. In order to satisfy her customers' orders she needs a source of finance to buy more shoes and meet the requests of her customers. 

She is married and has a three year-old boy.

loans.use: to buy men's shoes and women's sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pannetone and Christmas doughnuts.

loans.name: Ma.chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling cheese in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her cheese making business.

NWTF is relisting Ma. Chona's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make cheese.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana started her business 2 years ago with her own working capital of $500.  She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough working capital to buy stock in her kiosk. 
Joana has been busy with her business. After a year, she knew Tuba Rai Metin; she came to get information and she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional supplies including  noodles, oil, sugar,coffee and other stock to keep in her kiosk. 
She also has 2 children to look after. all of them are in school.  She lives in a simple house made of bricks and roofed with zinc. She wants to make her kiosk a big store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, oil, sugar, and coffee and other stock to keep in her kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen, de 20 años, es una mujer amable, responsable y muy trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en su casa propia al lado de toda su familia conformada por sus padres y hermanos es así como continúa a diario en la mejora de su calidad de vida por el bien de su familia. El negocio de Karen consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, todos los días desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a sus clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento en busca de algún producto con la seguridad que ahí encontrarán lo que necesitan. Su bodega es la más surtida de su barrio y sus clientes no dudan en comprarle por la calidad de todos los artículos que ofrece y por el trato tan cordial que expresa en cada una de sus palabras. Recuerda que cuando se inició en éste negocio no tenía muchos productos que ofrecer por lo que no lograba tener buenas ventas durante el día, eso la desanimaba a menudo, sin embargo buscó la solución, completó un pequeño capital y poco a poco fue implementando su pequeña tienda, ahora le va muy bien en sus ventas y desde entonces hasta la actualidad han transcurrido 5 años de mucho trabajo.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es intercambiar con sus clientes instantes de felicidad, conversar con ellos y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para atender su bodega, aún cuando se siente cansada, sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, espera que más adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el crédito individual número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta trabajando con la institución por la confianza que le brindan.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500), comprará mayor cantidad de productos con los que implementará su tienda de abarrotes conformada por panes, gaseosas, embutidos y golosinas.
texts.en:
Karen is 20 years old, she is single and she has no children. She is a lovely, responsible and hardworking woman who lives in her own house along with her whole family, which includes her parents and siblings, and she daily works to improve her standard of living as well as for the sake of her family. Karen runs a general store where she sells groceries and basic necessities. She opens the doors of her shop very early every morning in order to tend to her customers, who come to her shop because they know they will find what they need there. Hers is the best supplied store of her neighborhood, and her customers have no doubts in buying her products both because of the quality of every article she sells and for the deep kindness she expresses with her every word. She remembers that when she started her activity she did not have many products to offer, and for this reasons her sales were not good in those days. This initially discouraged her, but she succeeded in finding a solution. She gathered a small working capital and she started supplying her shop a little bit at the time; 5 years have passed since those first days, and things are now going very well with her sales.
What she likes the most about her job is to share moments of happiness with her customers, chatting with them and watching them start their day with a smile. She says that getting up very early to go to work in her shop is the part she finds most difficult; however, even when she feels tired she knows that this is her job and that she has to do it. She hopes that her activity will grow in the future, thus granting her a better income. This is the 5th individual loans she is requesting to MFP: she is very happy to know she can count on financial support, as through this mean she will feel more confident in making her activity progress; at the same time she once more commits to punctually comply with the repayment of her dues, just as she has done with the previous loans she has requested. She is very happy to be working with the institution because they confide in her.
The 1500 PEN she is requesting will be used to buy more products to supply her general store. She will buy bread, fizzy drinks, canned food and sweets.

loans.use: To buy bread, fizzy drinks, canned food and sweets.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Minda has a business making and selling native foods (bibingka) in the Philippines. Minda requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Minda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Estelvina

texts.es: La señora Estelbina agricultora del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos han sabido aprovechar las tierras, su sueño es poder tener mejores condiciones y dejarle un  buen porvenir a sus hijos, actualmente necesita darle mantenimiento al plantillo de Pitahaya, piñas para que en su proxima cosecha puedan ser de buena calidad los frutos, con el nuevo financiamiento comprara los insumos necesarios para sacar adelante su cosechar con un  poco de Urea, Completo, Fertilizante podra tener buenos cultivos el proximo año, gracias a Afodenic doña Estelbina a mejorado de vida un poco y lo importante ha sacado a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en: Estelbina farms in the municipality of Ticuantepe; together with her husband and children, they have taken advantage of the land. Her dream is to have better conditions and leave a good future for their children. Currently they need to carry out maintenance of the Pitahaya plantillo; so that the pineapples in the next harvest will be good quality fruit. With the new financing, she will buy the necessary supplies to advance the harvest with some urea, supplements and fertilizer so they can have good crops next year. Thanks to Afodenic, Estelbina has improved life a little bit and most importantly, she has gotten her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Ángela De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Ángela es comerciante de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, entre otros productos.
Tiene seis años de tener su idea de negocio, con lo que genera otros ingresos para apoyar económicamente a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
Su negocio ha mejorado significativamente con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y la demanda de sus clientes es mayor cada día.
Por lo que le es necesario un préstamo que fortalezca su inventario de producto para dar respuesta inmediata a sus clientes.
Es una persona disciplinada, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, y atiende a sus clientes desde las ocho  de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.
Su estado civil es casado, su esposo es fotógrafo, y juntos tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos están estudiando aun.
texts.en: Angela’s a merchant; she sells basic grains like rice and beans, sugar and corn, among others.  She’s had this business idea for six years and generates income to help her husband economically to cover household expenses.  Her business has improved significantly with much effort and dedication and customer demand is greater every day which is why she needs a loan to strengthen her inventory and provide immediate response to her customers.  She’s a disciplined person.  Her business is located in the municipal market and she’s open for business from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.  She’s married and her husband’s a photographer.  They have five children together four of which are still in school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store with.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Victor,  junto a su esposa han luchado mucho para poder cumplir son su sueño, terminar su casa, el trabaja para una empresa privada como guarda de seguridad al mismo tiempo tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos y ropa de segunda el cual su esposa le ayuda, su mayor dificultad es recaudar el dinero de una sola vez,  para asi comprar  todos los materiales a necesitar, Gracias al nuevo financiamiento que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kivan podra comprar lo siguiente: Cemento, Ceramita, Zinc, Perlines, Arena, Hierro etc.
texts.en: Victor and his wife have struggled much to reach their dream: to finish building their house.  He works for a private firm as a security guard and also has a business selling second-hand shoes and clothes his wife helps him with.  His greatest difficulty is amassing enough money all at once to buy all the materials and supplies he needs.  Thanks to the new loan from Afodenic in conjunction with KIVA funds he will be able to buy the following: cement, tile, metal sheeting, roofing purlins, sand, rebar, etc.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
Doña Juana es comerciante de cosméticos de la marca avon, además de vender comidas fritas como tacos, enchilada y refrescos naturales.
Su idea de negocio nace por iniciativa propia y para apoyar a su esposo para solventar algunos gastos de su casa.
Antes se dedicaba a vender mariscos de casa en casa, sin embargo ella descubre en desarrollar un negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Su negocio requiere de una fuente de financiamiento que permita ampliar y mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
Su estado civil es casada, y tiene a su cargo un hijo en actualmente estudia su secundaria.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is a merchant who sells Avon cosmetics.  In addition, she sells fried foods, like tacos and enchiladas, and natural sodas. 
She started the Avon sales on her own initiative and to help her husband with the household expenses. 
Previously, doña Juana made her living selling shell-fish door to door.  Nevertheless, she has found a way to develop a business right in her home. 
Her business requires a financial pool that would allow her to expand and improve her customer service. 
Doña Juana is married and takes care of one son, who is currently in secondary school.

loans.use: to purchase Avon Cosmetics.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun and her husband, Pheap have been married since 1990. In addition, they also make palm sugar for sale. They have five children-three sons and two daughters. The family is living in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Aun is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seed and fertilizer to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Florissa

texts.en:
This is Florissa, 36, resident of Caloocan, Philippines.  She is married to Marlon, a driver, and the mother to her children.  She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Florissa owns oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business.  She has one unit (14-16 person capacity), which is paying the boundary (daily quota) each day.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operating of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florissa dreams of having her own house and lot, and hopes to give her children a good and quality education.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins.  hey were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain.  Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Rapuncel

texts.en:
Rafuncelis a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17000 PHP through NWTF to buy more shampoo, canned goods, sugar, soap, and other items to sell in her general store. 

Rafuncel has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Rafuncel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store,

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 62 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lily is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy seeds and other farm supplies.

Lily has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Vutha (in the photo) is a scarf weaver. Her husband, Nen is a farmer and does construction work when he is free. 

The couple has been married since 2008 and they have no children yet. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vutha had asked for Kiva loan (www.kiva.org/lend/369991). She is now asking for another in the amount of 1,000 to help fund capital for her husband farming business. He will repair his water pumping machine because the old one is breaking and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to fund her husband's business so he can repair his water pump and buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for eleven years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Arante

texts.en:
Arante is a 34 year old married man and a father of three young children from Ubay, Bohol.  He earns a living through his fishing ventures.
Arante is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets.  With a loan, he will be able to improve his fishing business.
In the future, Arante dreams of expanding his business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets

loans.name: Joelisa

texts.en:
Joelisa is a 34 year old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than ten years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Joelisa is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes tiene 26 años de edad, casada tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 7  años,  ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de la Circunvalación, ella vive en casa familiar, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona que cumple con sus pagos, es responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado. El la foto la Sra. Mercedes esta acompañado de su esposo.
texts.en: Mercedes, 26, is married and has a 7-year-old son.  She sells stationery supplies, office supplies, books, etc.  She sells a wide variety of goods according to the season.  Her general/book store is located in the Circunvalación zone.  She lives in the family home and is asking for a loan to stock up on school supplies for her bookstore-general store since she does very well in that the store is well-located and sales are good.  She’s a person who makes her payments, is responsible and hardworking and grateful to the institution for the support provided.  In the photo, Mercedes’ husband appears with her.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her bookstore.

loans.name: Ingris Sudelvia

texts.es:
Doña ingris es comerciante de zapatos de adultos y niños por catálogos, su forma de vender es ambulante de casa en casa por encargos, también tiene clientes en algunas instituciones del gobierno como el ministerio de familia y de educación.
Ella inicia en esta actividad comercial para ayudar a cooperar con los gastos del hogar, y de esta forma a presupuestar las necesidades de primera necesidad junto con su compañero de vida.
Tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos en edad escolar.
Actualmente necesita capital de trabajo para adquirir un pedido de zapatos con los que se proyecta en atender algunos encargos de sus clientes.
Ella es una persona responsable y con deseos de superación personal.
texts.en: Ingris sells shoes for adults and children via catalogue.  She sells door to door from place to place on order; she also has some customers in a few government institutions like the family and education ministries.  She started this commercial activity in order to contribute towards household expenses and be able to budget for basic needs with her life companion.  She has three children one of which is school age.  She currently needs working capital to pay for an order of shoes she plans to use to fill some pending customer orders.  She’s a responsible person with a strong drive towards personal improvement.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson’s dream is to become a chemical engineer. He is currently enrolled in a university program but is struggling because he cannot afford to buy the necessary materials for his courses. Growing up with six brothers and 3 sisters his family of 10 always struggled with their finances. Both his parents are farmers and as such their income is often seasonal or dependent on the harvest. Nelson has another sibling in university, a further strain on his family’s resources. He works part time to contribute, but only takes home around $3 a day. The chemical engineering field is growing in Bolivia and Nelson is expecting to earn around $16 a day when he finds a job in this field. With this in his future, Nelson is anxious to finish school and begin working. With this income increase he could help his younger siblings go to school and together they could pull their family out of poverty.

loans.use: the books he needs to finish his courses

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta has seven brothers and a sister. Although some of her older siblings have left the house, she still lives with her parents and five siblings. Between the eight of them, they live on $16 a day. Violeta’s parents only had the opportunity to receive a primary education and with low paying jobs in construction, higher education is not in their budget. Desperate for a better life Violeta works 30 hours a week in order to pay her tuition. She is passionate about finance because she sees it as a growing field in Bolivia and a career with a great future. With the money from this loan Violeta plans on buying a computer and her school books.
