She spends much her free time working, and during the small time she has to study, Violeta works hard to fit in all the new material. Having a laptop will allow her to not only better manage her time but also understand finance better. Violeta calls Bolivia “a country in development.” With a degree and a career in finance she feels she will be prepared for a new era in Bolivia. Moving from earning $9 a day to $14 will allow Violeta to help her family and invest in her future.

loans.use: to pay for a computer and books she needs to graudate

loans.name: Paula Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Paula se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas suaves su crédito lo invirtió en compra de maíz, leña y cal ingredientes necesarios para el producto final, tiene treinta y seis años de edad y es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares. 
Lleva dieciséis años ejerciendo dicha actividad su negocio se ubica en una calle céntrica lo que le favorece para vender todos su producto elaborados. 
Es importante mencionar que su tiempo es aprovechado al máximo ya que por la mañana trabaja como asistente del hogar (DOMESTICA) con lo cual lleva un poco mas de ingreso para la unidad familiar y poder hacerle frente a sus obligaciones. Por lo que prácticamente solo las tardes le quedan para hacer sus tortillas de maíz.
texts.en: Paula works making soft tortillas.  She will use her loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder, ingredients needed for her final product.  She’s 36-years-old and the mother of two school age children.  She’s been in said activity for 16 years and her business is located in a centrally located street which is favorable for selling all she makes.  It’s important to mention that she uses her time to the maximum because she works as a domestic employee mornings earning a little extra for her family and to be able to fill her obligations so she’s only able to make corn tortillas in the afternoon.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and lime powder.

loans.name: Aracelle

texts.en: Aracelle is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Aracelle is married and has two children. To make a living, Aracelle runs a retail store. Aracelle engaged in her business for 4 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. Aracelle is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods, sugar and coffee. In 2010, Aracelle joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like snack foods, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Jackelinne Benita

texts.es: La señora Jackelinne sigue con la misma actividad ella tiene una licoreria cuenta que le fue bien con el credito crecio en su actividad y en esta ocacion solicita el prestamos para la compra de vino y cidras por mayor por estas fechas de fin de año hay mucha demanda de estos productos y ella desea abastecerse y asi tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Señora Jackelinne is keeping on with the same business; she has a small liquor store.  She says that everything went well with the last loan and she was able to grow her business.  This time she is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale wine and ciders for the end of the year.  There is a lot of demand for those products and she wants to be well stocked so she can earn a greater income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale wine and ciders.

loans.name: Franklin José

texts.es:
El Sr. Franklin a sus treinta y cuatro años de edad es docente de educación primaria de un centro escolar de san Rafael del sur, en dicha actividad lleva un poco más de quince años, este y todos sus créditos han sido para mejoras en su casa ya que con los crédito otorgados por kiva es que ha logrado ir mejorando su vivienda.  
Es importante mencionar que anteriormente su casa las paredes eran de laminas de zinc y con sus créditos ha logrado tener una casa más confortable con paredes de bloques y pisos de cerámica.
texts.en:
Franklin is 34 years old and has been a professor of primary education in a school in san Rafael del sur for a little more than 15 years.

This and all of his loans have been for improvements to his home. With the loan granted by Kiva, he has managed to improve his home.

It is important to mention that his previous house had walls made of zinc sheets. With his loans, he has managed to have a more comfortable home with block walls and tile floors.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as sand, cement, blocks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Las Chamacas Group

texts.es:
Grupo perseverante de mujeres con espíritu joven. Han permanecido fieles a su compromiso de crecimiento financiero para seguir ofreciendo un mejor futuro para sus familias.
Ana Verónica, mujer, esposa y madre de dos hijos, es un ejemplo de ellas. Ella inicio la venta de artículos de limpieza aproximadamente hace tres años enfocada solo a la solo a la materia prima. Después de este tiempo, a decidido a comprometerse con un nuevo crédito para comprar materia prima como: aluminio, madera, tornillos; y generar equipos de soporte para complementar los artículos de limpieza. 
Ella esta convencida que este nuevo producto en su negocio inyectara y atraerá más clientes y con ello ampliaran su mercado.
texts.en:
This is a group of persevering women with a young spirit.They have remained faithful to their commitment of financial growth to continue to provide a better future for their families.

Ana Verónica, woman, wife, and mother of two, is an example of them. She started selling cleaning supplies approximately three years ago focused only on the raw material. After this time, she decided to commit herself to a new loan to purchase raw materials like aluminum, wood and screws, and generate support teams to complement the cleaning supplies.

She is convinced this new product will increase her business and attract more customers, and thereby expand her market.

loans.use: to invest in raw material for carpentry to generate support teams for cleaning products.

loans.name: Amigas De Laura Caller Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el  grupo Amigas de Laura Caller

Este grupo está emprendiendo su primer ciclo, son 06 socias que se conocen entre sí. Elizabeth es la presidenta del grupo ella  tiene 35 años, es casada con 07 hijos; actualmente tiene a su cargo a 4 de sus hijos los mayores ya son independientes, hace 10 años empezó su propio negocio con el único fin de ayudar a su esposo con el sustento de su familia. Elizabeth trabaja vendiendo ropa de niños los artículos que ofrece van desde medias, ropas interiores y zapatos. Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado donde ofrece sus productos a toda su clientela, el dinero de su préstamo lo utilizara para mejorar su negocio con la compra de diversos artículos para niños como ropa y calzado, en el futuro le gustaría abrir otra tienda con el mismo rubro. Elizabeth está muy agradecida por el préstamo para su grupo comunal, especialmente a EDAPROSPO y a los Inversionistas de todo el mundo.
Elizabeth aparece en la foto con polo blanco y pantalón azul
La sra.que viste polo color turqueza es una invitada del grupo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. This is the Amigas de Laura Caller Group. 

This group is beginning its first cycle. There are six members who know each other. 

Elizabeth is the president of the group. She is 35 years old, and is married with seven children. Currently she has responsibility for four of her children, as the older ones are already independent. She began her own business ten years ago in order to help her husband support the family.

Elizabeth works selling children’s clothing offering articles ranging from stockings to underwear and shoes. She has a stand at the market where she offers her products to all her customers.

The money from the loan will be used to improve her business with the purchase of diverse articles for children such as clothing and shoes. In the future she would like to open another store with the same items.

Elizabeth is very grateful for the loan for her communal group, especially to EDAPROSPO and the loaners from around the world.

Elizabeth appears in the photo with the white polo and blue pants. 

The lady wearing the turquoise polo is a guest of the group.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cruz esta casada, tiene 26 años de edad, cursó los grado de diversificado, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes típicos, inicio este negocio con el apoyo de sus suegros y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y así mejorar su producción de tejido de cortes, espera que a través del préstamo va a mejorar su trabajo y sus ganancias. En el futuro quiere tener mas trabajadores.
texts.en:
Maria Cruz is 26 years old and married. She studied diverse subjects. She has 3 children, none of which are in school. She is dedicated to working with typical cuts of fabric. She started this business with the support of her in-laws, and so far has 8 years of experience. She has the support of her husband who supports her financially.

She requests a loan that will be used to purchase different colors of yarn, thus improving her production of textile cuts. She hopes to improve her work and her earnings through the loan. In the future she would like to have more workers.

loans.use: to buy yarn for fabrics.

loans.name: Las Forjadoras De Villa Del Norte Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú!  Este  el grupo Las Forjadoras de Villa Del Norte

Este grupo es nuevo, son 5 amigas que lo conforman, una de las socias es la Sra. Delia de 43 años. Ella es divorciada y vive con sus 02 hijos. Delia se dedica a diferentes oficios, en su casa tiene una bodega donde vende toda clase de productos de primera necesidad, también alquila una parte de su casa como cochera donde los comerciantes del  mercado  guardan sus carretas, gracias a los ingresos que percibe puede darle a sus hijos una buena educación y sustentar los gastos básicos que su familia requiere. Delia siempre quiso tener un negocio propio para no descuidar a sus hijos y se siente feliz de haber logrado su sueño, ahora quiere continuar trabajando para mejorar  su bodega y surtirla con mas productos, el préstamo que EDAPROSPO le otorgara lo invertirá básicamente en la compra de productos navideños en especial panetones y chocolates, en estas fiestas navideñas las ventas aumentan por eso quiere abastecerse de estos productos para poder satisfacer a su clientela.
Delia quiere agradecer a todos los inversionistas por apoyar a su grupo Comunal, en la foto ella viste polo color azul.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This group is called Las Forjadoras de Villa Del Norte.

This group is new. Five friends formed it. One of the members is Delia who is 43 years old. She is divorced and lives with her two children.

Delia is engaged in different trades. She has a store in her home where she sells all types of staples. She also rents a part of her home such as the garage where the market traders keep their carts.Thanks to the income she gets she can provide her children with a good education and cover the basic household costs her family requires.

Delia always wanted to have her own business so as to not neglect her children and feels happy to have achieved her dream. Now she wants to continue working to improve her store and stock it with more products. The loan that EDAPROSPO will provide her will be invested in the purchase of special Christmas products such as panettones and chocolates.

During the holiday season sales increase and that’s why she wants to stock these products in order to be able to satisfy her customers.

Delia wants to thank all the loaners for supporting her communal group. In the photograph she is wearing a blue polo.

loans.use: to buy panettones and chocolates

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en: Lupe is 24 years old.  She is married and has three children. She would like to start a small business, selling ie lavalava (traditional skirt) or elei. In order to do this, Lupe needs a loan to purchase ie lavalava, paints, brush and design board to start her new elei. She hopes to use her profits to save for the kids' education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy paints, design board, paint brush,.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo, which is taken inside his store.

Laila is a 20-year-old married woman. For the past three years, Laila's husband has had a small cosmetics store located in a busy area in Jabalia's market. This store contains several beauty products such as hair products, face and hair creams. This project is considered to be a very successful one, but it needs more support to cover costs.

Laila took a USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband buy more cosmetic products for the store. This loan will help the family to increase their income.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Hendrick

texts.en: Hendrick lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with six children, two of whom attend school. She also looks after her grandchildren and elderly mother. She has been operating a food stall selling fresh peas and beans for five years, working six days a week. She also sells local brew as another source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy baskets of fresh cow peas, beans, tomatoes and green peppers to sell at her stall. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business and accumulate profits to buy land and start growing peas and beans. She joined MCDT SACCO because of group lending and the weekly repayment schedule. She lives in a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh cow peas, beans, tomatoes and green peppers to sell at her stall

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 30 years old. She is married to a farmer and has five children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past seven years.  This business has enabled her to provide food for her family. Francine needs a loan in order to buy more potatoes, bananas and cassava for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She is planning to celebrate Christmas with her family.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, bananas and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Senh

texts.en:
Senh was born in 1948. She has five children. They are building workers and carpenters. She and her husband sell rice cakes to earn a living. Her income is about 2,500,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy ingredients to make rice cakes and to sell them. She always wants to save enough money for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make rice cakes to sell.

loans.name: Sinavaimalama

texts.en: Sina is 30 years old.  She is married and has five children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Sina  needs a loan to purchase more chemicals, vegetable seeds and a wheelbarrow to extend her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Sina will use the profits from her sales to save for her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling eggs. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional trisikad.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: For this loan cycle, Clara is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy more groceries to sell in her store.  The native mat-making business that she previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF continues to provide for her and her family with an income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and has three children. She sells various types of merchandise and has been in the business for one year. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal, cooking oil and maize flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To add more charcoal, cooking oil and maize for sale.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with four children, all of whom are attending school. His wife is a businesswoman. For the last two years, Hamisi has been operating a general store, selling basic grains, food stuffs, and cleaning products, among other items. It has been a profitable project since it has given him good results.

For the last few weeks, demand has risen and he wants to take advantage of this. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of  20,000 KES to add stock of flour, cooking oil, basic grains, and medicines.

Hamisi desires to expand his business to a wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, cooking oil, basic grains, and medicines.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 54 year old widow with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Erlinda has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Hortense Charlotte

texts.fr: est une femme de 34 ans fiancée. Elle a ouvert un café-restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 02 ans déjà dans un marché de la capitale. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'acheter de produits de restauration(alvéoles d'oeufs, petit matériel de café, spaggetti et les casiers de boisson...pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses ventes, la satisfaction de sa clientèle ainsi que son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité.
texts.en: Hortense Charlotte is a 34 year old woman who is engaged. She opened a café-restaurant which she has been managing for 2 years already in a market of the capital. It's thanks to the café-restaurant that she takes care of her family. Buying catering products retail does not really bring in much for her. Thus the importance of this loan for her business because it will allow her to buy catering products (crates of eggs, small café materials, spaghetti and cases of drinks) to cook her dishes. This will avoid her having to make daily trips and will reduce her taxi expenses. It will also increase her sales, the satisfaction of her clientèle as well as her profits. She will reinvest part of these profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy catering products (crates of eggs, small café materials, spaghetti and cases of drinks).

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah  is married with six children, three of whom are dependents. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and paying utility bills. 

Deborah  has been in the fish selling business for three years, and sells to all categories of people on retail. She doesn’t have any other side income.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of fish.  She works seven days every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to help her with transportation.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Kokab

texts.en:
Mrs. Kokab is a 31-year-old, married woman and the mother of two daughters and one son.  She is striving hard to meet her family's demands, including food, clothing, and healthcare.  Her husband is employed in a small restaurant.  His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family.  

She started her business to contribute to the family income.  She has been in the sewing business for many years, and is very familiar with the stitching techniques.  She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation, and used her first loan to buy a sewing machine.  At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons and needles, so that she can meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different colored thread, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida earns a living through her retailing business. She sells ready-to-wear clothes and accessories to the people in her area in San Miguel, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock like shirts, pants, slippers and other items. In the future, Leonida hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her six children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like shirts, pants, slippers and other items

loans.name: Joseph Brice

texts.fr: Brice est est un jeune homme  de 23 ans commerçante. il fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 2 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et souhaiterai acheter un camion des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Brice is a young 23 year old shopkeeper. He has been selling fresh food (maniocs, plantains, palm nuts and fruits) retail according to the seasons in a local market for 2 years. He has good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of his clientèle that he gained with time thanks to his experience in this domain. He would like to buy a truckload of bunches of  plantains to have a good stock which will allow him to better satisfy the constant demands of his clientèle and to avoid stock shortages. He will save his profits to not only expand his business but also to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of plantains.

loans.name: Zainab Y.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 13,800,000 Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they will be empowered to meet their immediate financial needs and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Lansana is the leader and featured member of this group. He is a native of Faama village in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple have 7 children: 3 in primary school, 1 in secondary school, and 3 in college. Fifty-six year old Lansana has been a professional teacher for 32 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, sand, cement, rods, etc. so he can build a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for a house

loans.name: Bouweh

texts.en:
She is married with three children and lives in a two-room apartment house in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West region of Cameroon.

She has encountered so many difficulties in life, including inadequate finances to pay tuition fees for her children.  Because of this, the children are constantly being driven out of classes for the late payment of school fees and not having school supplies like pens, pencils, exercise books and text books.  She has also been facing a great challenge with her children in her husband's house due to marital problems including her husband’s family members, the death of her father, the ill health of her mother and the inability to provide three square meals to her family each day.

With the new loan, she will improve her documentation business by buying a modern photocopier and papers for photocopying.  She will also buy cosmetics like rubbing oil, lotions, bathing soaps and body treatments that are in high demand in her locality.  She believes her business will succeed because of her expertise, the activity is in high demand in her community, she has a strategic business site near a school so students always photocopy papers from her, and she has good marketing skills in approaching new customers and maintaining old ones.  The activity will benefit the people in the community because they will not need to go long distances to photocopy papers, photocopies will be made at a very moderate rate and the cosmetic products will be sold to them at reduced prices.

The profits will help her improve the housing conditions of her family, provide them with better education and healthcare, and expand her business.  She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to pay for a photocopier and cosmetics for re-sale.

loans.name: Mwamvumbo

texts.en:
Mwamvumbo, 43, is married and has six children.  He lives with all of his family in Tiribe which is in Coast Province, Kenya.  Mwamvumbo describes himself as a tranquil, unassuming person with a desire for self-improvement.

He works as a retailer and sells mattresses.  This is the second loan he has asked for from Yehu.  He will use it to buy more mattresses which will help him increase his merchandise and meet his customer demands.  This business helps Mwamvumbo to increase his income which helps him support his family.  His dream is to stay in business with his family and, in the future, be able to open more businesses.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses for re-sale.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia 
Grecia 
C 600.000

Ligia tiene 42 años de edad vive con 2 hijos y su esposo, además cuida a una nieta en la ciudad de Grecia, en la provincia de Alajuela.  Mujer emprendedora, trabajo en Norte América para apoyar el estudio de su hija que ahora es una profesional en leyes. Adquierió capital con el que construye un taller, ya que siempre ha trabajado en costura. Se asocia con la señora  Lucia a quien le confecciona uniformes para grupos de ejercicios y trae mercadería de Estados Unidos que comercializa en la zona y en lugares aledaños. Independiente y trabajadora.

 Trabajo en Estados Unidos, donde con ahorro y adquirió maquinaria y mejoró las condiciones del taller. Solicita el préstamo para adquirir una maquina especial para dar un mejor acabado a la ropa y comprar materia prima para el trabajo con la empresa SEV (Salud, Estética y Vida) de confección de uniformes. La actividad cuenta con un patrimonio importante, maneja 2 negocios que le generan ingresos fijos, desea mejorar la calidad de su producto adquiriendo una máquina especial.

Ella se levanta temprano a organizar su casa, a media mañana se dedica a cortar las telas para elaborar las prendas en la tarde y durante la noche se dedica a cobrar y vender la ropa. Desea darle el estudio a su hijo para que se convierta en profesional al igual que su hija mayor.

 Cuenta con maquinaria y equipo para su trabajo, clientela donde coloca su producto y espera darle un mejor acabado con el equipo que va a adquirir. Tiene amplia experiencia en la costura y además los contactos en Estados Unidos le permiten tener el negocio de venta de ropa donde trae mercadería de calidad obteniendo un margen de ganancia importante.
texts.en:
Ligia 
Grecia 
600,000 CRC

Ligia is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, in addition to caring for a granddaughter, in the city of Grecia in the province of Alajuela. She is a hardworking woman who worked in North America in order to support her daughter's studies. Now her daughter is a legal professional. She acquired some capital with which she built a workshop as she has always worked as a dressmaker. She has a business partner, Lucia, with whom she makes uniforms for exercise groups. She brings merchandise from the United States and sells it in her community as well as in neighboring communities. She is independent and hardworking.   

She worked in the United States where she saved up, bought equipment and improved her workshop conditions. She is requesting a loan to buy a special sewing machine to give her clothing a nicer finish and to buy basic materials for a job with the SEV (Salud, Estética y Vida) company making uniforms. The business has important assets. She runs two business that generate fixed incomes. She hopes to improve the quality of her product by purchasing a special sewing machine. 

She gets up early to get the house together. By mid-morning she is cutting the fabric to make garments and in the afternoon and evenings she takes orders and sells the clothing. She hopes to be able to give her son an education so that he will become a professional like his older sister.

She has the machinery and equipment for her business and customers to sell her products to. She hopes to be able to give her product a better finish with the equipment she will purchase. She has a lot of experience in dressmaking as well as contacts in the United States that allow her to have a business selling clothing in which she brings quality merchandise making a significant profit margin.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and basic materials to make garments.

loans.name: Tukundane Group

texts.en:
Evelyn, a repeat client of Tukundane Group, is in her third cycle. She is married with six children, all are going to school. In addition, she cares for two dependents who are relatives. She takes care of all their needs.

Evelyn is taking the loan to buy plantains for sale to her clients. Since it's the festive season, there will be many customers buying plantains for the season which will increase her sales and income. 

With the income, Evelyn will get money to buy some new clothes for her children. She will also save some money to pay school fees for the children's next academic year. 

Evelyn's main challenges are price fluctuations and stiff competition in the market since she trades in an area where plantain-growing is a major economic activity. She is excited that she will make a big profit this season and thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for partnering with her and coming to her aid in such a period when she needs money the most. Evelyn is very hard-working.

loans.use: to buy plantains for resale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 42 year old married woman and a mother of four children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for almost ten years. 
Lorna is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Lorna hopes of expanding their business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for her boat

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 48 years old. She lives in the Kobuleti district with her husband and three children. Makvala is a tailor and gets a monthly income. As the existing income isn’t enough for five-member family Makvala decided to start a trading business. She has requested a loan from local credit providers to start a business, but her loan requests were always rejected because of lack of experience in a new business.  

Her loan request was approved under the guidelines of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans for business start-up and re-start up to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit. They are often regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the credit Makvala will purchase clothing and gifts and set up a store. She hopes that her project will be profitable as there is not a similar store nearby. Makvala will gradually increase the sales volume and turnover.  The living conditions of her family will significantly improve and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and gifts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman and a mother of two grown children. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She has run a motorcycle repair shop with her husband for several years.

Lydia is asking for a loan to buy more material for motorcycle repair like fluids, nuts and bolts, screw drivers and more. With this, they will be able to cater to more customers in their repair shop.

In the future, Lydia hopes of improving their business.

loans.use: to buy material for motorcycle repair like fluids, nuts and bolts, screw drivers and more

loans.name: Anabel De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Anabel es comerciante de ropa usada, actividad de negocio que en Nicaragua ha tenido una gran aceptación por lo accesible en sus precios.
Tiene cinco años de vender este producto, y lo realiza de forma ambulante de casa en casa.
Debido a que su negocio ha contribuido a generar ingresos importantes para sufragar los gastos del hogar y por la experiencia que ha adquirido durante estos cinco años de ejercer este oficio, necesita aumentar su negocio con un préstamo que le permita diversificar su actividad comercial y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Ella es madre soltera, tiene un hijo a su cargo en edad escolar y necesita el empuje económico para su idea de negocio.
texts.en:
Anabel sells used clothing, which has become a good business in Nicaragua and has been well accepted because of the good prices.

She’s been doing this for five years and sells on foot from door to door.  Her business has allowed her to generate an important income that has helped defray the household expenses and, because of her experience, she needs to grow the business with the help of a loan.  This will allow her to diversify and provide better service to her customers.

She is a single mother and has one school-aged son to care for.  She needs a financial boost for her business idea.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.
